title: Executive Business Partner - GTM (Remote)
description:
CoinTracker makes cryptocurrency portfolio tracking and tax compliance simple. Beyond cryptocurrency, we are building a general automated financial assistant for all financial assets. Our mission is to increase the financial freedom and prosperity of the world.

  

Some things we’re proud of:


Building foundational tools in the cryptocurrency space


$50B+ in cryptocurrency is tracked on CoinTracker – over 5% of the entire crypto market


1M tax forms filed


Partnered with Coinbase, Uniswap, OpenSea, eToro, H&R Block and other industry leaders


Venture-backed by Accel, General Catalyst, Y Combinator, Initialized Capital, Coinbase Ventures, Kraken Ventures, Intuit Ventures, 776 Ventures, Balaji Srinivasan, Claire Hughes Johnson, Gokul Rajaram, Ryan Shea, Serena Williams, Zach Perret, and others


Founders: Jon previously built TextNow (200M downloads), Chandan was previously a product manager at Google & Google[x]

  

Learn more about our mission, culture, and hiring process.

**Your opportunity**
--------------------


As the Executive Business Partner to the GTM lead you will have a significant impact on the success of CoinTracker. You will support your lead with administrative and operational support, including calendar and email management, internal and external communications and travel coordination. By listening, observing, and learning as much context as possible, you will become an extension and force multiplier of your leader, anticipating needs, and “seeing around corners” on their behalf. You will report into the Executive Business Partner to the CEO, as part of the early stages of a centralized EBP org structure.

**1-year outcomes**
-------------------

* Email, calendar, and travel management and coordination are an art that you have perfected and fully own.
* With your guidance & facilitation, your leader spends close to 100% of their time on the allocated areas of work that are most important for their success; especially in developing exec relationships with all the top crypto industry leaders.
* You are an extension of your leader, anticipating their needs, providing administrative & operational support, and “seeing around corners” on their behalf.
* With your operational excellence, CoinTracker’s presence at all the top crypto conferences & events is up-leveled and organized.
* You are a strong and active member of the EBP team, supporting and planning broader company events in partnership with other EBPs and your x-functional partners.

**You will**
------------

* Provide strategic calendar management (including time audits) and scheduling for your leader.
* Strategically manage email triaging and travel for your leader.
* Support leader in internal and external communications; acting as a strong culture carrier who embodies and exhibits company values and goals in all internal and external facing relationships.
* Support your leader in fostering relationships with external industry leaders.
* Support and plan events and projects with and for your leader’s teams.
* Support and plan broader company events in partnership with broader EBP team and x-functional partners.

**Some of the skills that we are excited about**
------------------------------------------------

* Has 5-6 years of experience providing strategic administrative support for business leaders; with deep attention to detail, context-switching, and energy management.
* Acts as an extension and force multiplier of the leaders you support; anticipating needs, providing administrative & operational support, and “seeing around corners” on leaders’ behalf.
* Quickly analyzes and resolves tasks, and improves operational opportunities that are in alignment with leaders’ goals and priorities.
* Strong culture carrier who embodies and exhibits company values and goals in all internal and external facing relationships.
* Works effectively in a remote setting, is available for in-person events multiple times per year, and is available during pacific time (PT) working hours.
* Showcases deep openness to growing, learning, and to giving and receiving feedback.
* Creatively solves problems; finding quick solutions and innovative ways to solve unforeseen situations.
* Displays exceptional discretion and maintain a sense of nuance with confidential and sensitive information.
* Demonstrates strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Demonstrates high EQ.

**What's it like working at CoinTracker?**
------------------------------------------


We are a fully internationally distributed, tight-knit team. We have minimal process, and the majority of our time is spent working and collaborating asynchronously through tools like Figma, Github, Google Meet, Linear, Notion, Slack, Zendesk. We also stay aligned and bonded through weekly sprints, standups, all hands, and socials. We aim to empower every individual on the team with full transparency, ownership, autonomy, and clear objectives. Learn more about our guiding principles.

  

If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you! Not sure you’re a perfect fit? Reach out anyway. We’re looking for awesome individuals, not folks who perfectly match a job posting.

title: Senior HR Business Partner, US Remote
description:
The Human Resources Business Partner is a strategic partner who proactively identifies solutions to business issues within Human Resources with main emphasis in the following areas: talent acquisition, including the recruitment of diverse, high-performing candidates; adjudication of HR process and procedures; employee relations support; compensation and benchmarking; immigration; retention; work within an HRIS; and the continual enhancement of a positive work experience for Sage's employees.

**Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities:**

* Works with minimal supervision in a highly visible position.
* Fosters strategic partnership with leadership to provide insightful counsel and support for business decision making.
* Acts in a consultative role with the utmost confidentiality, tact, and diplomacy.
* Works extensively with all levels of leadership and staff using sound business judgment.
* Acts professionally internally and externally to proactively promote Sage as an Employer of Choice in both the geographic and publishing communities.

**HR Generalist-Type Responsibilities**

* Performs HR duties that are generalist in nature with an emphasis on recruitment and onboarding, immigration cases, employee relations, and compensation analysis and benchmarking.
* Provides confidential and appropriate consultation to managers and/or individual employees for employment relations matters and compliance issues (e.g., progressive discipline, grievance resolution/investigations, performance management, harassment allegations, morale, work/family issues).
* Proactively communicates with appropriate managers on the 90- and 180-day probationary review process.
* Works with the Director, Organizational Development in the continuous feedback process for U.S. and Canadian employees including reviewing documentation by managers as needed, assisting with meetings between managers and staff in delivering feedback, etc.
* Researches, develops and/or revises, implements, administers, and interprets company HR policies, procedures, and programs.
* Prepares ad hoc department reports for management, detailing employee information/HR data, as needed.
* Conducts benchmarking to ensure compensation is a match for the job description and geographic market.
* Works in partnership with managers who enter employees into the progressive disciplinary process, ensuring thorough and appropriate communication, documentation, and fairness to the employee and the business.
* Acquires approvals and processes for immigration paperwork with highest accuracy.
* Brings a solid understanding of employment laws and regulations to maintain Sage's position as an Equal Opportunity Employer and to ensure policies and procedures are in compliance and are fair and equitable.
* Ensures company compliance with federal and state mandated programs such as EEOC reporting requirements, AAP reporting and compliance, etc. and other legislation that impacts the employer-employee relationship.
* Performs other projects and duties as assigned by the AVP, HR and OD.

**Recruiting:**

* Reviews job description with hiring manager to be sure it is properly classified as overtime eligible or exempt and that it is up to date. Ensures updated job description is stored in the appropriate HR folder.
* Creates text for recruitment advertising and reviews with hiring managers to ensure job description is properly reflected and contains neutral language as it relates to gender, race/ethnicity, and age.
* Manages and implements specific recruitment strategies to achieve required staffing levels, including recruitment of a diverse group of qualified candidates for consideration.
* Meets with hiring managers to review and agree on specific recruiting plans for approved open positions. As needed, supports the development of interview questions with managers.
* Determines the most effective placement of recruitment advertising/posting to ensure approved positions are filled with the qualified and appropriate candidates at the lowest cost in the least amount of time using a variety of recruiting techniques and avenues.
* Supports professional relationships with college, university, and community placement offices, employment agencies, advertising agencies, etc. and attends appropriate job/career fairs to generate qualified applicants.
* Manages recruitment efforts, including conducting initial screenings and interviews, working with the scheduling team to schedule interviews of applicants with hiring managers and other internal interviewing staff, working with the manager of interns to conduct appropriate job testing, initiating background screenings, and extending employment offers.
* Recruits for overtime-eligible and exempt positions needed.
* Coordinates details of relocation, when appropriate, including securing temporary housing, etc.
* Writes appropriate and accurate offer letters (using approved templates and good judgment for exceptions), promotion memos, transfer memos, etc.
* Ensures accuracy of data needed on employee change notices (ECNs).
* Works with hiring manager to create a high-quality onboarding experience in new employees’ first days and weeks.
* Tracks, analyzes, and prepares hiring/termination data and cost analyses as needed, such as exit interview analyses, making suggestions for new analyses as appropriate.
* Participates in the preparation of the recruiting assumptions for the annual Human Resources budget.
* Works with the HR Business Partner colleague in charge of temporary recruiting requests, including selection of agency for utilization, placement of order, coordination of requirements/details, interfacing with agencies on problem resolution, coding/processing invoices.
* Prepares exit documentation for voluntary terminations and conducts exit interviews.

**Education, Skills, Experience and Qualification Guidelines:**


Include, but not limited to, the following:

* 4 to 6 years of progressively responsible positions in Human Resources.
* Working knowledge of employment law, both federal and state.
* Computer literate in Microsoft Office word processing and spreadsheet applications.
* Experience with immigration law administration, AAP compliance, and PHR/SPHR accreditation preferred. Equivalent experience welcomed.

**LANGUAGE SKILLS, REASONING ABILITY AND ANALYTICAL APTITUDE**

* Ability to maintain high level of confidentiality and professionalism and work with tact and diplomacy while maintaining a sense of humor.
* Reasoning/problem-solving ability, effective decision making, sound business judgment.
* Excellent emotional intelligence/perceptive skills, capable of developing and maintaining positive relationships with individuals at all levels within the organization as well as with external resources and applicants.
* Ability to develop and maintain extraordinary working relationships with a variety of business leaders and employees, which includes possessing excellent communication skills, listening reflectively, maintaining objectivity.
* Sensitive to corporate needs, employee goodwill, and public image.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, excellent interpersonal capabilities, and strong presentation skills.
* Ability to work with constant interruptions.
* Multitasking ability.
* Project management ability.
* Effective internal/external customer communication.
* Ability to effectively manage vendor, contract, or consulting relationships.
* Ability to meet deadlines and work professionally under pressure and with a sense of urgency.
* Proficient math skills.
* Ability to effectively manage budgetary responsibility and analyze costs.
* Ability to work in an ever-changing, fast-paced environment requiring flexibility.
* Ability to read, analyze, and interpret concepts, documents, etc.


 If you have a disability and you need any support during the application process, please contact **hr.resume@sagepub.com**. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply.

**Pay Transparency & Benefits Package:**


Sage Publishing is committed to being an inclusive employer where all individuals are treated with fairness and respect. Sage is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer.


Compensation at Sage is influenced by several factors, including but not limited to skill set, nature and level of experience, qualifications, and other relevant considerations. Please note that the compensation details listed in U.S. role postings reflect the base salary only and do not include bonuses or benefits. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range and additional aspects of the compensation/benefits package for this position during the hiring process. If your desired salary falls outside of this range, we hope you'll still apply as there may be other positions that better align.


In addition to compensation, Sage offers a highly competitive and comprehensive PPO medical, dental, and vision care benefits package with SAGE covering most of the premium costs. Unique program benefits that support a healthy life, a company-sponsored anniversary trip every 5 years, a 401(k)-matching program of 100% up to 5% of pay, and other significant meaningful benefits. In alignment with our value for education, Sage offers financial support for bachelor's and graduate-level degree programs as well as learning for personal interest.


Sage offers freedom and autonomy in your day-to-day with hybrid or remote work, depending on the role. Join the nearly 2,000 Sage employees worldwide who deliver products and services that serve to fulfill our noble goal of education and dissemination of knowledge globally. We’d love to meet you!

**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**


At Sage we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team that is representative of all sections of society and to sustaining a culture that celebrates difference, encourages authenticity, and creates a deep sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, disability, sex or gender identity, sexual orientation, color, race, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief as creating value through diversity is what makes us strong. As a business and as an organization with an increasingly agile workforce, we're open to flexible working arrangements where appropriate.

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
**Human Resources Business Partner- REMOTE**
At Salas O’Brien we tell our clients that we’re engineered for impact. This passion for making a difference applies just as much to our team as it does to our projects. That’s why we’re committed to living our values every day: inspiring, achieving, and connecting as shared owners of our success with a focus on a sustainable future.
Building for the long-term means that all of our team members can expect to work on amazing projects with a people-first approach to problem solving. It also means that each member of our team has truly limitless potential to build a unique, meaningful, and high-impact career—and they’ll receive great total rewards along the way.
**About Us:**
Founded in 1975, Salas O’Brien is an employee-owned engineering and professional services firm focused on achieving impact for our clients, our team, and the world. We know that tomorrow’s requirements are today’s opportunities, and we are here to design lasting solutions for pressing challenges.
We work across a variety of industries providing integrated engineering and consulting services. Our specialized experience includes design for data centers, healthcare, science and technology, high-rise buildings, clean energy, education, and other building types as well as structural and building sciences, infrastructure asset management, advanced robotics, and more.
Our technical expertise is paired with an exceptional team of business development, human resources, finance and accounting, information technology, and marketing professionals, all of whom play a key role in bringing our commitments to life every day.
The **Human Resources Business Partner** will play a key role in the success of our rapidly growing firm by helping to create a distinctive team member experience through various programs and touchpoints across the team member’s career. They will deliver HR solutions that actively contribute to both business growth and a thriving company culture by forming a robust HR partnership within the operational facets. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate extensively with our HR team across multiple offices, fostering continuous enhancement in HR service delivery and processes while integrating and sharing best practices.
To thrive in this role, you should be an energetic professional with a deep understanding of the business and how HR decisions impact our success.
**Specific duties include (but are not limited to) the following**:
* Create a distinctive onboarding experience for new team members, guiding and supporting them through orientation processes
* Foster a culture of continuous learning, supporting team members at every stage of their journey
* Act as the primary point of contact for HR questions for the local team members
* Assist with the creation, documentation, and implementation of new HR programs
* Support benefits administration, including open enrollment
* Collaborate with the Salas O'Brien Recruiting team to attract top talent for open roles and ensure an exceptional candidate experience
* Manage the offboarding process and conduct exit interviews, synthesizing feedback to identify trends and propose initiatives to address highlighted concerns
* Advocate for ongoing feedback between team members and their managers, offering support and guidance to managers
* Foster team member engagement and retention, proposing strategies to enhance our work environment based on feedback
* Ensure the accuracy of payroll data in each cycle and maintain the integrity of HR systems
* Additional project support within the HR function as needed and available


**Your Background**
* Minimum 5 plus years’ experience in a similar Human Resources role
* Experience working in a matrixed environment as a sole HR Practitioner
* Experience working in the AEC industry is a plus
* Advanced experience with MS Office products including Excel, Word, Outlook, and Teams
* Degree or Diploma in Human Resources with a SPHR or SHRM-SCP designation preferred

 **Additional Attributes**
* Energetic, fun, solution-oriented, self-motivated, hardworking, roll up your sleeves and get it done type personality
* Ability to prioritize and complete work promptly without active supervision is critical, but similarly important is knowing when to ask for help
* Focused on HR trends, developments, and best practices
* Critical thinker with innovative problem-solving skills
* Excellent communicator, both written and verbal that can multitask and respond quickly to competing priorities.

**Location**: Remote
**Travel**: 10%
**Equal Opportunity Employment Statement**
Salas O’Brien provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/provincial, or local laws. Salas O’Brien will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants as required by law.  


#LI-REMOTE

title: Sr. Manager, People Partner
description:
Blue Bottle Coffee is a passionate and growing team of hundreds around the world, united by the simple purpose of connecting the world to delicious coffee. We roast on three coasts, make delicious drinks, clean up after ourselves, bake cookies, get change at the bank, and say please and thank you. We’re an impossibly eclectic group of coffee experts, artists, writers, sensory scientists, bakers, designers, and all-around dreamers, who also happen to be some of the most hardworking and talented in the business. Join us.* **This is a remote-based position with a requirement for employees to be based in one of the following seven metropolitan areas**:


The San Francisco Bay Area
Los Angeles
San Diego
Boston
Chicago
DC
New York City **About the job**
Blue Bottle is writing a new chapter in the story and traditions of coffee, food, and hospitality, and the People team is helping us build the company and culture to do it. Blue Bottlers love our company, products, and mission - a great foundation from which to make Blue Bottle the place to start and pursue a career in world-class hospitality and delicious food & beverage.  

Our Sr. People Partner Manager will be responsible for partners and align business units with People functions. Provides leaders and managers with consulting and guidance to support our vision, mission, overarching objectives, core pillars, and values. In addition, they are accountable for delivering comprehensive, guest-focused people services and for aligning people management and business strategies.  

We are building the next great company that everyone wants to work for, and this role is critical to pursuing that mission as we grow.  


### **You will:**

* Strategically lead and manage a team of People Partners in daily people operations in the US, ensuring the highest levels of employee engagement and satisfaction
* Serve as the People Partner for regional leaders and administrative staff in North America regions; and as the direct manager for the People Partners who support our production and retail teams
* Contribute to the development and execution of People related initiatives based on an understanding of different perspectives; gather agreement with stakeholders before implementing the initiatives
* Provide thought leadership regarding organizational and people-related strategy and execution
* Establish company policies and procedures for the locations we support
* Provide insights and solutions to both internal and external customers to achieve positive results beyond highlighting issues
* Provide leadership to reporting staff with clear direction, regular honest feedback and personal development
* Counsel managers and/or employees on employment issues, including investigations of complaints or concerns, focusing on promoting a high level of employee morale and establishing a positive employer/employee relationship
* Proactively and effectively address complex people operations issues; mitigating risk and managing situations that result in the best possible outcomes for the company, teams, and people
* Consistently review existing processes, systems, and policies for improvement. Develop and adapt to change with the collaboration of all relevant key internal stakeholders to produce the most effective outcome
* Ensures compliance with all employment and labor laws locally - we are always meeting and sometimes exceeding our legal and compliance obligations
* Proactively implement and execute foundational employee trainings
* Work closely to align the local People practices with Blue Bottle’s guidelines and initiatives

### **You are:**

* Strategic, structured and savvy
* A leader who is both a great role model as well as a fantastic coach who brings out the best in others
* Deeply focused on delivering top-notch internal hospitality and customer service to our team
* Collaborative and build trust-based relationships with employees
* Comfortable with ambiguity, rapidly changing environments, and building from scratch
* Analytical and metric-oriented, always seeking internal and external data to validate our approach
* Have a great sense of humor, high sense of humility, and insatiable curiosity
* Creative and use your creativity to overcome unexpected challenges while producing quality results for the company

### **You have:**

* At least 8 years HR experience
* Minimum of 5 years of which would be working at a managerial level preferably
* Led HR team in a high-growth environment with a team supporting employees distributed across multiple locations
* Expertise in core HR service functions such as benefits, workers’ comp, payroll, employee relations
* Experience in retail, hospitality, food/beverage industries is strongly preferred
* Broad and deep experience in all areas of HR including Employee Relations, Recruitment, Compensation & Benefits, Performance Management, Training, and Organizational Design
* Great understanding of employment/labor laws for the areas in which we operate
* Prior success in implementing HR policies and strategy from the ground up
* Last but not least, a deep love for great coffee, food, and exceptional customer experiences

### **Physical Requirements:**

* The following is a list of the physical activity, requirements, and environmental factors related to this role. Blue Bottle is committed to partnering with all candidates and employees to ensure reasonable accommodations are made to meet the following:
* Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word;
* Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication.
* Making substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers.
* Close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal and written documentation
* Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Occasionally walking, climbing stairs, and standing occur in this role.
* Environment: this role is protected within a building, but may be exposed to mild changes in temperature with heating or air conditioning.

### **Travel:**

* This role requires travel up to 25%. Additional walking, stooping, sitting, and mobility may be required. Exposure to outside environmental elements may be experienced due to travel through airports, airplanes, and in between facilities

### **A few benefits we offer:**

* This position has a minimum salary of $142,860. This salary is a good-faith estimate for this position. The final salary offer will be determined after reviewing relevant factors, which include a candidate's qualifications and experience, where appropriate.
* Health, dental, and vision coverage for eligible employees starting on your first day
* 401(k) plan
* Paid time off
* Discounts on any Blue Bottle food items and merchandise

  

At Blue Bottle Coffee, you’ll be a vital part of our guests’ experience and a crucial link in delivering the most delicious coffee we can find to every person who walks through our doors, be it in person or online. If you’re ready to bring beautiful and thoughtfully rendered experiences to life, please apply and join us.  

Blue Bottle is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value an open mind, dedication to work, and a collaborative spirit. We hire based on these qualities, a job’s requirements, our business’s needs, and an applicant’s qualifications. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind—in the hiring process or in the workplace.  

We comply with the ADA and consider reasonable accommodation measures that may be necessary for eligible applicants/employees to perform essential functions.  

We may refuse to hire relatives of present employees if doing so could result in actual or potential problems in supervision, security, safety, or morale, or if doing so could create conflicts of interest.  

We will consider employment-qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  

We participate in E-Verify. We will provide the federal government with employees’ Form I-9 information to confirm authorization to work in the U.S. We will only use E-Verify once an employee has accepted a job offer and completed Form I-9.

title: HR Business Partner - Construction
description:
#LI-Remote
A DAY IN THE LIFE* Partners with business leaders and Human Resources colleagues to build functional credibility, enable positive change, and proactively support business strategies through consultation and guidance on a wide array of human resources topics, including compensation, employee relations, labor relations, employee engagement, learning and development, talent solutions, and performance management
* Serves as a primary HR contact to site leadership, providing guidance and direction related to their human resources needs in support of business strategies.
* Coaches site leaders regarding human resources policies, programs, and processes designed to promote healthy work environments, employee engagement and a culture of continuous growth.


WHAT YOU’LL NEED* Minimum of three years of related experience working collaboratively within a complex, highly matrix environment with a strong business acumen.
* Experience navigating state and federal employment laws with demonstrated experience managing confidential matters with discretion and sensitivity.
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field required or equivalent human resources experience.


WHAT WILL SET YOU APART* An interest in traveling 50%.
* Ability to problem solve, think strategically and analyze data.


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU* Competitive pay
* 100% employer-paid HDHP insurance premiums for employees
* 100% employer-paid dental insurance premiums
* 401(k) with company match
* HSA and FSA options
* Vision insurance
* Education Assistance (Tuition Reimbursement)
* Work/Life balance
* Employee/Family focused culture
* Gym on site
* And more!


WHO ARE WE?
Blattner Company is a leading renewable energy contractor and service provider with utility scale wind, solar, and energy storage projects across the United States. Based at our headquarters in Avon, Minnesota, we are powered by over a century of construction experience and passionate, innovative employees.
Be a part of something bigger and join the Blattner team – Leading America to a clean energy future!*Blattner is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Blattner will not tolerate discrimination against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of age (40 and over), ancestry, color, religious creed, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, mental disability, military or veteran status, national origin, physical disability, race, receipt of public assistance, sex, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local laws. This commitment governs all aspects of employment including, but not limited to: hiring, promotion, demotion, transfer, layoff, termination, compensation, discipline, and access to benefits and training. Additionally, Blattner is committed, in accordance with applicable law, to making reasonable accommodations for job applicants and employees based on a qualifying disability, a sincerely held religious belief or practice, and for pregnancy, childbirth or related health conditions. Applicants and employees who feel they have experienced or witnessed discrimination or who wishes to request a reasonable accommodation should contact the Human Resources Department. Blattner prohibits retaliation against any individual for making a complaint under this policy, for opposing discrimination, for participating in an investigation pursuant to this policy, or for requesting a reasonable accommodation.*

title: Human Resources Business Partner
description:
\\_


Dawn Foods is a global leader in bakery manufacturing and ingredients distribution. As the partner of choice for inspiring bakery success, we help customers grow their business through meaningful partnerships, research-driven insights and innovations, and products and expertise they can depend on. As a family-owned company, our commitments to our people, products, customers, and corporate values, are all part of our recipe for success.


\\_


**Why work for Dawn Foods?**

  


**PEOPLE.** **PRODUCTS.** **CUSTOMERS.**

  


**Why should you apply? We invest in you!**


* Industry-leading health insurance on Day 1!
* Competitive Pay
* 401(K) + company match
* 10 Paid Company Holidays
* 3 Weeks Paid Time Off
* Professional training
* Family-owned business over 100 years in service
* An opportunity for career advancement, working as part of an empowering workforce

  




**Job Purpose and Overview**


In support of Dawn Foods Distribution business, the People Business Partner is a critical role to drive change and create value within the team. Driving People organization and services, this role will have a defined focus on driving efficiency and positively impacting our teams in distributions centers across the West and Central regions. As a People Business Partner, this role is both a strategic and hands-on role that provides full cycle Human Resources support to the distribution centers. This role will be a knowledgeable and committed resource, driving positive impact by working closely with leaders to build teams that can achieve our business vision, while staying true to our Dawn culture.

  


**This is a fully remote position with up to 50% travel for our Distribution Centers in the West. A California home base is preferred.**

  


**What will you do as a People Business Partner at Dawn Foods?**


* Assist with difficult personnel matters including personnel issues, investigations, performance improvement plans, and terminations.
* Develop, lead, and execute strategic human resource initiatives that are in-line with business objectives to drive results while ensuring alignment with corporate direction, strategic initiatives, and human resources best practices (e.g., talent acquisition, development, and training; team member engagement; talent management; performance management; legal compliance; compensation; benefits policies and practices).
* Drive innovation to solve problems, identify opportunities to improve organizational effectiveness, and deliver a high level of HR service.
* Hands-on approach with understanding the population as well as the ability to successfully monitor the "pulse" of team members to ensure a high level of employee engagement.
* Lead the Performance Management process for the Distribution Center Leaders to identify team member development needs and support the process by up-skilling/ raising awareness amongst team members and leaders to build bench strength.
* Conduct and facilitate Talent Review process for Distribution Regions, participate in talent reviews for North America, and conduct appropriate talent follow-up.
* Assures compliance with all applicable Federal, State, and Local laws within the region.
* Support leadership to recruit, retain, develop, and optimize performance and engagement of individuals and teams.
* Demonstrates the “Dawn Values” of Team Dawn and supports the Dawn Circle of Excellence. Performs other related duties as assigned and requested.
* Supports the engagement of business leaders in Diversity & Inclusion efforts by driving specific components of the Diversity & Inclusion plan & ensures the integration of such activities into all standard HR processes and procedures.
* Work with leaders to assess the overall current and future resource and talent levels across the department and determine short-, medium- and long-term strengths, gaps and needs, incorporating diversity.

  




**What Does It Take to be a People Business Partner at Dawn Foods?**


* Bachelor’s degree in human resources, Industrial Relations, or other related business field is preferred with 5 plus years’ experience.
* 5 - 7 years of relevant experience in Human Resources
* PHR or other relevant certification preferred.
* Ability to work in a highly matrixed, multi-site environment under high pressure and time constraints.
* Must be adept/knowledgeable in managing HRIS systems and processes and equally have the skillset of compiling data sets out of those systems that can be reviewed and interpreted by regional leadership.
* Must be experienced and adept in interpreting & escalating issues to the proper leadership tracks for rapid intervention.
* Previous experience or knowledge of basic talent acquisition procedures.
* Ability to leverage strong interpersonal skills to communicate clearly and effectively in all situations at varying levels of the organization; including but not limited to senior leadership.
* Strong ability to be a self-starter and takes initiative to perform duties independently as well as in a team.
* Proven ability to motivate teams, manage conflict, and maintain a high level of confidentiality at all times.
* Strong reasoning, analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills.
* Ability to understand the likely consequences of implications of actions or events.
* Ability to present effectively in diverse circumstances.
* Ability to conceive ideas, patterns, or relationships from limited data.
* Strong attention to detail.
* Ability to deal with difficult situations involving sensitive and confidential employee issues.
* Demonstrated ability to effectively manage change and meet multiple priorities and deadlines.
* Previous SAP, Success Factors Experience.
* Ability to analyze, summarize, and resolve complex issues in a calming manner.
* Bilingual (Spanish/English) a plus

  




**Physical Demands & Work Environment**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  


* Required to use motor coordination with arm, hand, finger, and leg dexterity.
* Required to exert physical effort in handling objects 25 pounds.
* Required to walk, sit, stand, and climb stairs
* Normal setting for this job is manufacturing facility

  




Note: The level of physical effort may vary from site to site and in some cases be greater or lesser than documented here.

  


***If this sounds like the opportunity that you have been looking for, please click "Apply.”***

  


**About Our Benefits**


Dawn is proud to employ the top talent in the baking industry, and we reward our people with comprehensive health and well-being coverage, competitive compensation packages, and award-winning benefit offerings. We also help protect your future financial health with a generous 401(k) matching program that provides additional retirement funds and many tools and resources on financial wellness. Dawn encourages professional growth through tuition assistance and educational programs, and we are always searching for ways to improve our industry-leading services and benefits.

  


Compensation: $86,580 -138,530 with an annual bonus potential

  

#LI-Remote


#LI-MW1

  



\\_


An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, citizenship status, military or veteran status, genetic information or any other status or condition that is protected by applicable law.

  


**Requisition ID:** 35093

title: Sr. Human Resources Business Partner
description:
Overview:

Aretum, a leading government contracting company specializing in technology-enabled mission support services, is seeking a highly experienced and motivated Senior HR Business Partner to join our team. As a Senior HR Business Partner, you will play a critical role in aligning human resources strategies with business objectives and providing strategic HR guidance and support to our employees and managers.  

ARETUM Holdings, LLC (ARETUM) is known for providing cutting-edge solutions and outstanding service to Federal clients in various sectors, including Next Generation Analytics, Engineering Services, Training Services, IT Systems, Cyber Security, PMO Support, and Financial Consulting. Our mission is to deliver technology-driven solutions that meet the unique needs of our government clients, enabling them to achieve their objectives effectively and efficiently.
Responsibilities:
* Partner with business leaders to understand their organizational needs, challenges, and objectives, and develop HR strategies to support business goals.
* Provide guidance and support to managers and employees on a wide range of HR topics, including performance management, employee relations, talent development, and workforce planning.
* Lead and manage HR initiatives and projects, such as policy development, employee engagement programs, and diversity and inclusion efforts.
* Ensure compliance with applicable HR laws, regulations, and company policies.
* Manage employee relations matters, including investigations and conflict resolution.
* Partner with the HR team to develop and implement HR programs, policies, and processes that support the company's culture and values.
* Stay updated on HR trends and best practices, and proactively identify opportunities for continuous improvement in HR practices and processes.


Qualifications:
* Minimum of 7 years of experience in HR, with at least 3 years in a strategic HR Business Partner role.
* Understanding of OFCCP Compliance
* Strong Knowledge of Employee Relations
* Strong Knowledge of FLSA, FMLA, COBRA, and ADA Compliance
* Strong knowledge of HR principles, practices, and regulations.
* Experience working in the government contracting or related industry is preferred.
* Proven track record of partnering with business leaders to develop and implement HR strategies that drive business performance.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with the ability to analyze complex HR issues and provide effective solutions.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive HR matters with discretion and professionalism.
* HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.

title: Sr. Human Resources Business Partner - Corporate
description:
Company: Oak Street Health


Title: Sr. People Experience (HR) Business Partner


Location: Remote in Chicago, IL

  

Role Description:

  

The People Experience (PeEx) Business Partner, Senior Associate is a strategic partner at the corporate level that will immediately become an important contributor and key collaborator to assigned business units to ensure our people strategies align with business objectives. They will leverage people data to help establish people strategies throughout their client groups, and will ensure the effectiveness and compliance of Human Resource initiatives and activities, while acting as a strategic partner to leadership and resource to employees.

  

Core Responsibilities:

* Utilize people data to identify trends and areas of opportunity, and develop and implement action items and people strategies in partnership with leadership accordingly
* Work with leadership to develop change management plans surrounding new initiatives and rollouts, organizational updates, updated policies, etc., anticipating potential impact and need, and advising accordingly
* Support employee performance management, including reviewing and approving of corrective action measures while ensuring consistency of policies and guidelines
* Mitigate risks and the need for third-party representation as well as analyze trends and make proactive recommendations
* Ensure compliance with all legal and regulatory concerns including: Federal, State, and local laws and regulations related to the Human Resources function such as FLSA, ADA, Civil Rights Act of 1964, and FMLA
* Manage employee relations investigations and employee concerns for assigned business units
* Help create a culture that fosters a high level of employee trust by celebrating the open door policy and being a model of our values; provide coaching and advice to senior leadership and local managers, as needed
* Support ongoing employee engagement efforts, providing guidance and recommendations to leadership as needed
* Manage and help enhance employee recognition programs
* Partner and liaison between corporate PeEx central team and field team
* In partnership with the PeEx Talent Acquisition Team, aid in recruiting efforts, as needed
* Continuous partnership with Leadership related to Human Resources items and initiatives
* Other duties, as assigned

  

What weâ€™re looking for:

* Minimum of 5 years of strategic Human Resources business partnership experience required, experience in a corporate setting supporting Information Technology teams preferred
* Bachelor's degree required
* SHRM-CP and/or PHR certification is a plus
* Ability to deal with ambiguity
* Strong professional presence
* Proven planning, priority setting, and time management skills
* Ability to quickly build trusting relationships, gain credibility, and partner with leaders and peers
* Adhere to the highest degree of professional standards and strict confidentiality in matters that require discretion
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
* Flexible, self-starter, able to manage multiple ongoing projects without close supervision in a fast-paced environment
* A demonstrated team-orientation with all levels of employees
* Strong MS Excel skills
* Access to reliable transportation is required
* US work authorization
* Someone who embodies being â€œOakyâ€

  

What does being â€œOakyâ€ look like?

* Radiating positive energy
* Assuming good intentions
* Creating an unmatched patient experience
* Driving clinical excellence
* Taking ownership and delivering results
* Being relentlessly determined

  

Why Oak Street Health?

  

Oak Street Health is on a mission to â€œRebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patientâ€™s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. Weâ€™re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody â€œOakyâ€ values and passion for our mission.

  

Oak Street Health Benefits:

* Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for Medicare patients
* Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options
* Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits
* Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends
* New centers and flexible work environments
* Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement

  

Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.

  

Learn more at www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health

title: People Business Partner
description:
REMOTE
Business
Business
  
**About Us**


Chess.com is one of the largest gaming sites in the world and the #1 platform for playing, learning, and enjoying chess.


We are a team of 700+ fully remote people in 60+ countries working hard to serve the global chess community. We are here to support 150M+ chess players worldwide with the best possible product, content, and tools to serve the community!


We are a tech company. A gaming company. A content company. And we do it all with passion and commitment to the game. Above all we prize our mission-driven, flat, life-celebrating, no-corporate culture, and we look forward to meeting you and learning more about what you can bring to the team.

**About You**


You’ll work with our People team to keep our business and people strategies in sync across Chess.com teams. You’re an experienced business partner who takes pride in supporting the development of happy, healthy, high-performing team members. You’ve worked in tech or start-ups and understand how to build strategically and execute at scale, zooming in and out seamlessly. You have a passion for chess (no matter your rating) and growing the game.

**What You’ll Do**

* Serve as a trusted advisor and partner to our Creative and Business teams, using your expertise in people practices to offer guidance and solutions for managers that build on performance, support employee relations, develop our teams, and support across people-related matters within the org.
* Handle sensitive employee relations matters, including conducting investigations, addressing concerns, and offering guidance on conflict resolution, while ensuring compliance with employment laws, policies, and best practices across our global team.
* Collaborate with managers to proactively identify and capture opportunities to keep our teams aligned to the mission, leaning into our values to enhance team member experience and maintain our positive, no-corporate work environment.
* Partner with leadership and the Talent Acquisition team to understand talent needs and connect them to the recruiting process, helping to ensure we’re hiring top, mission-aligned, and values-driven candidates.
* Support managers in planning for the future, developing their teams, and providing great and timely feedback to cultivate a culture of organized and mission-fueled professional growth.
* Analyze people metrics and data to identify trends and recommend actionable steps to enhance our people programs and processes across the teams.
* Provide guidance and interpretation of our people policies, procedures, and employment laws to leaders and team members.
* Collaborate with People Ops to provide company-wide support in additional areas of functional passion or expertise.
* Actively contribute to Chess.com’s positive and global culture.
* As part of a rapidly growing company, embrace the change and shift of responsibilities and roles over time.

**Preferred Skills and Qualifications**

* Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources or a related major
* 8+ years of experience as a HR/People Business Partner in tech or gaming; experience at rapidly scaling companies a plus
* Comfortable working with international teams with demonstrated success in remote, a-sync environments
* Outstanding general computer and technology skills, including cloud software such as Google Workspace or Notion
* Possess strong logical thinking and data analysis ability
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Sense of ownership and responsibility
* Take an entrepreneurial approach to their work and learning new skills
* Chess player
* Lifelong learner

**About the Opportunity**

* This is a full-time position
* We are 100% remote (work from anywhere!)
* This position is open to applicants in the United States or Canada

  

You can learn more about us here:


https://www.chess.com/blog/erik/how-chess-com-s-100-person-virtual-team-works-together


https://www.chess.com/about


We look forward to meeting you!

title: Sr HR Business Partner - Infrastructure
description:
Overview:

The Senior HR Business Partner is tasked with ensuring alignment between the business operations and HR practices and objectives of multiple locations and/or companies within the segment. The Senior HR Business Partner provides consulting and coaching to departmental leaders and managers in order to support the business’s vision, mission and overall objectives. The Senior HR Business Partner will focus on business growth, workforce strategy, consulting, talent initiatives, organizational effectiveness, change management and leadership development. The Senior HR Business Partner maintains an effective level of business literacy about the business unit’s financial position, its midrange plans, its culture and its competition.  

This position will support MasTec Infrastructure companies.
**This position is required to be located in** **Phoenix,** **Arizona.**
Responsibilities:
* Lead, develop and inspire in a high growth, rapidly changing environment
* Responsible for onboarding/training all new HR Generalists
* Direct supervisory and leadership responsibility for assigned HR Generalist team
* Implement talent strategies and support strategic resource forecasting
* Partner with business leaders to implement and support HR strategies, programs and initiatives that support the overall strategic direction and goals
* Build strong relationships with local management and management throughout the enterprise to fully understand their needs and make recommendations for improvement related to workforce planning, processes, culture, and other HR related items
* Takes active part supporting the Regional HR Director on designing and executing long-range HR business objectives and strategic plans focused on workforce planning and staffing, talent management, succession planning and competitive performance-based total rewards
* Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance
* Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics
* Provides guidance, advice and training to managers and employees, on employee relations and HR topics, including policy and procedure interpretation
* Advises Management on correction action (discipline) for employee’s misconduct, employee performance issues, serious violations of company policies
* Acts as business unit liaison to other departments in the organization such as Training & Development, Talent Acquisition, Marketing/Communications, and Culture Analytics and Strategies teams
* Leads change by partnering with leaders on planning, implementing and communicating necessary changes involving employees
* Partners with the Compensation group on promotions and pay adjustments to ensure pay equity.
* Upon project award review contracts, local, state, and federal laws for compliance needs. Work with project management and assigned recruiter to create and communicate a plan for compliance with all requirements and regulations
* Encourages and assists leaders to focus on increasing top talent and development of employees
* Maintain a high level of HR and industry knowledge to recognize efficiencies throughout the organization and remain compliant with federal/state laws and regulations
* Coach, educate, and advise management on HR related policies, procedures, compensation and benefit programs, employee discipline, and laws pertaining to employee relations to ensure consistent and fair treatment of all employees
* Lead special projects in relation to organizational goals and strategies
* Other duties as assigned by the Human Resources Director


Qualifications:
**Education and Work Experience Requirements:*** Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) and 5-7 years related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Previous supervisory experience with direct reports
* Experience within Construction Industry is preferred
* Professional certification is preferred (ex. SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP)
**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:*** Take reasonable care of your own and others’ health and safety and of those who may be affected by the day-to-day delivery of this role
* Analyze and organize data into reports and management information
* Write routine reports and correspondence
* Speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization
* Solve practical problems and make appropriate decisions based on facts and figures
* Interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral or schedule form
* Be familiar with and apply continuous improvement concepts with daily tasks
* Ability to travel as needed


MasTec, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer. The Company's policy is not to unlawfully discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local laws. The Company also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories. It is also MasTec's policy to comply with all applicable state, federal and local laws respecting consideration of unemployment status in making hiring decisions.

title: Principal People Business Partner
description:
Whether you binge-watch a series on Netflix, plan faraway vacations from your phone, or read international news online, you’ve likely used Apollo’s technology this week. Apollo supports some of the largest GraphQL platforms in the world.
  
We’re not looking to rest on our laurels though — we’re aiming to change how software is built. Apollo wants to empower every software team to build an amazing user experience across any number of clients, without dealing with a barrage of API endpoints. Equal to all of that, Apollo is intent on becoming the company where you can see your career grow through challenging work, collaborating with incredible teammates, and accomplishing the unattainable.
  
About the team and role
  
The People team at Apollo is dedicated to enabling and empowering all Apollo-nauts to do the best work of their careers. We are crafting a People team culture that prioritizes: simplicity, thoughtfulness, collaboration and accountability for results. Our work matters deeply to the success of the company and we’re laser focused on uplifting leadership skills and crafting an incredible employee experience. As a member of the People Growth & Development team, reporting to the CPO, your role will be equal parts dedicated business partner work, as well as growth and learning program development.
  
**The Business Partner work:** You will act as a key strategic partner to Sales, Marketing and Customer Success leadership. Developing and driving talent strategies that unlock performance, nurture our culture and bolster our Go- to- Market teams for what’s next. You are able to operate as a telescope - zooming out to see the whole picture, and develop the strategy, and then zooming in to drive tactical execution. This work will require you to have a strong grasp of compensation, employee relations, team and org development, coaching, conflict resolution, strategic planning and business acumen.
  
**The Programmatic work:** In partnership with the other People Business Partners, you will own the cyclical people program work, as well as the development of new company-wide learning and growth initiatives. Content creation, delivery and assessment, program implementation and management through KPIs will activate all sides of your brain! You’ll be able to build a portfolio of bespoke development opportunities based on data that will carry you far in your career.
  
Who you are
  
You care deeply about people. You’re fundamentally excited to be a part of building the people team of the future. You have an insatiable curiosity, humility and drive to hone your craft. You lead with a growth mindset – the work is never done and there’s something to learn from everyone. You embody our leadership principles in all that you do: creating clarity, unlocking performance and delivering results. What You'll Do
  
Support the GTM organization by developing and executing against high impact initiatives such as engagement, talent assessment and development, succession planning, organizational design, employee relations, compensation, change management and leadership development.
  
Deliver people programs to client groups - balancing company needs with your understanding of unique client group needs.
  
Drive workforce planning initiatives and build capabilities needed to achieve each department’s vision and strategy.
  
Build a crisp understanding of the business initiatives, and customize your strategy accordingly.
  
Leverage data to build insights and craft compelling stories that influence a diverse set of leaders.
  
Build out, continuously improve, and deliver high impact people programs and infrastructure that scales for growth.
  
Partner with our emerging Centres of Excellence to offer feedback, improve outcomes and be the bridge between the GTM group and the People team ensure we keep business impact front of mind in all that we do.
  
Partner with the People Growth & Development team to create and implement targeted talent development programs that drive impact across the company.
  
Expertly counsel and coach leadership and employees, leveraging your wisdom, business acumen and knowledge of local employment laws and best practices.
  
Use your strong working knowledge of compensation to drive better results. Minimum Requirements
  
Deep experience (8-10 years) in people business. partnership, across multiple stages of growing companies.
  
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills; an articulate and persuasive communicator.
  
Experience supporting a diverse set of stakeholders across a globally distributed, remote team.
  
Ability and desire to operate with a high degree of elasticity and to navigate through ambiguity.
  
Strong business acumen.
  
Experience creating and facilitating learning content in a remote environment.
  
A trusted coach and advisor - you are sought out for your counsel and operate with a high degree of professionalism.
  
Experience leveraging various tools and platforms to facilitate asynchronous collaboration, automation and communication: Slack, Google Docs, etc. Nice to have
  
Previous experience supporting a GTM team.
  
Executive coaching certification.
  
Experience with UK, French and German employment law. $195,500 - $230,000 a year
  
At Apollo, we strive to provide competitive, market-informed compensation whilst ensuring consistency within the team in each country. We make hiring decisions based on your skills, experience, and our overall assessment of what we learned during the hiring process.
  
In addition to the U.S. base salary range above, we also provide equity and benefits. Apollo offers all U.S. employees a choice of 3 Anthem Blue Cross medical plans and California residents can also choose from an additional 2 Kaiser medical plans. Dental and Vision benefits are provided by Sun Life Financial.
  
This position can be done from anywhere in the U.S. or Canada.
  
Apollo is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a talented and diverse workforce.
  
California residents applying for positions at Apollo can see our privacy policy here .
  
Apollo is an E-Verify employer and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. For more information please visit E-Verify.

title: Remote Human Resources Business Partner (Eastern US)
description:
***SUMMARY***


Concorde Career Colleges, Inc. (Concorde), operates 17 campuses across eight states focused on preparing America’s next generation of health care and dental professionals for rewarding careers. Concorde’s 25 student-focused academic programs and personalized support prepares graduates for in-demand careers in nursing, dental, respiratory, diagnostic and other health care roles. Concorde is accredited by the Accrediting Commission of Career Schools and Colleges (ACCSC) and the Council on Occupational Education (COE).


Concorde is looking for a dynamic HR leader to fill a Regional-Human Resources Business Partner (HRBP) position. The Regional-HRBP is responsible for aligning business objectives with employees and Concorde management. The position serves as a consultant to assigned Campus Presidents and campus leadership on human resources related issues. The successful HRBP acts as an employee champion and change agent. The role assesses and anticipates HR related needs. The position formulates partnerships across the HR function to deliver value-added service to management and employees that reflects the business objectives of the organization.

***SCOPE***


The successful HRBP manages human resources responsibilities for an assigned region, collaborating across other regions and with senior HR leadership to ensure consistency. Responsibilities include supporting the employee relations function and additional department functions while ensuring application of best practices in HR management. The HRBP implements operational efficiencies, and can be charged with overseeing benefits, payroll, compensation, performance management, training and development, termination, personnel records, legal compliance, employee recognition, ADA & FMLA leaves, or unemployment. Working in tandem with campus presidents, academic deans, managers and supervisors to engender culture of excellence and high performance in the workforce, the Regional HRBP will be required to display professionalism and uphold Concorde’s Mission and the core values of respect for the individual, integrity, teamwork, customer service, and achievement.

***KEY RESPONSIBILITIES***

* Partner with leadership in assigned region to implement HR best practices and provide proactive support of HR programs and approaches
* Manage ongoing HR processes and programs (performance management, orientation, development planning, salary administration, personnel files, benefits, etc. as assigned)
* Train Campus Leadership and Staff on relevant HR topics
* Mitigate risk to the organization and associates
* Consult with campus management, providing HR guidance and policy interpretation when appropriate
* Be readily available to assist and advise campus leadership on HR related questions
* Work closely with management and associates to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention
* Provide day-to-day performance management guidance to align with management on employee relations issues (i.e., performance, compliance with labor laws, etc.) and change management (e.g., coaching, performance improvement plans, counseling, and career development)
* Investigate and respond to third party discrimination charges as needed
* Assist with planning and communication of employee and career development processes
* Take responsibility for assigned content area(s) and lead company-wide development/enhancement of processes/programs
* Stay current on employment law and educate leadership on implications, monitoring state laws for any changes affecting campus locations
* Visit campuses as needed
* Perform other duties, as assigned

***EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION***

* Bachelor’s degree in human resources, business or related area, or equivalent experience
* Minimum 5 years of increasingly responsible human resources experience
* SHRM or HRCI Certification preferred
* Knowledge of Federal and State employment law
* Effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills displaying positive leadership characteristics
* Demonstrated collaborative, negotiating, counseling, and problem-solving skills
* Critical thinking and change management skills
* Self-starter, proactive, demonstrates sense of urgency and results-orientation
* Must have excellent organization and prioritization skills and demonstrate initiative and act in a self-directed manner
* Demonstrated presentation, coaching, and facilitation skills
* Experience working fully remote

title: IT Business Partner
description:
Job Overview:  

Cambium Learning Group is seeking a seasoned IT Business Partner to act as the liaison between business units (BU) and our corporate technical teams to drive effective, timely solutions that fulfill both strategic and operational needs.  

Job Responsibilities:* Conduct regular meetings with department heads within Business Unit (BU) to understand process and to ensure that BU IT needs are being met and dealt with appropriately.
* Conduct in-depth analysis to elicit comprehensive business requirements and use cases, to interpret and to recommend best built or bought solutions to align IT and business initiatives, including documentation and reviews for accuracy.
* Deliver precise functional specifications to include functional pecking order, workflow, business rules, interface design and definitions, outstanding issues, data analysis, and data mapping to end users and technical staff.
* Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions.
* Diagram process flows.
* Create and publish training videos for various company-wide systems.
* Prepare and deliver communications to various audiences including leadership.
* Create content and deliver Lunch and Learn sessions for existing employees.
* Work with the BU to get Intranet sites up and running.
* Conduct a technology review of existing systems when new software has been requested for vetting. If similar products exist, present options and assist with making judgments on appropriate software.
* Assist technical team with triage to ensure that requestor is aware of potential resolution options.

  

Job Requirements:* Experience in information technology, business solution development, and/or business/system analysis (10+yrs).
* Experience and knowledge in information technologies, processes, software development lifecycles.
* Proven technical aptitude (learns new processes and systems quickly) and ability to work autonomously, handle multiple priorities, and solve complex problems.
* Experience with process flow diagrams.
* Experience writing functional requirements
* Exceptional planning, systematic and problem-solving skills in providing technology solutions to business needs.
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work and interact with a wide variety of colleagues.
* Intermediate Excel skills. Experience using office tools such as Word, PowerPoint, and Visio.
* Proficiency in presenting technical information to a non-technical audience.
* Bachelor's degree or higher.

  

Preferred Skills:* Experience creating training videos.
* Experience with team collaboration tools, such as OneNote and Microsoft Teams.
* Experience with K-12 products and services.
* Experience with SaaS.
* Experience with Google Suite.
* Experience with managing SharePoint content.


To learn more about our organization and the exciting work we do, visit www.cambiumlearning.com
An Equal Opportunity Employer*We are dedicated to fostering a culture that celebrates unique backgrounds, ideas, and experiences. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.*
