title: HRBP (Human Resources Business Partner)
description:
HRBP
at Porch (View all jobs)
Oceanside, California/ Dallas/Fort Worth/ TX
Job Description


Porch Group is a family of technology and SaaS companies that offer innovative software and service solutions to more than 14,000 companies across the country.


Our mission is to completely transform the way people buy, sell, move, and manage their homes throughout their home journey. Sure, it's a tall order to transform a $320 billion industry, but we're already well on our way. Since we were founded in 2013, we've stuck to our values and our commitment to foster a "No Jerks, No Egos" culture, which is a big reason we've gone from a scrappy startup to a Nasdaq-listed company and the industry-leading partner for the home in less than eight years.


At Porch, no two days will ever be the same and you'll have the opportunity to help solve big problems, with a refreshing balance of team support and ownership of your work.


The future is bright for the Porch Group, and we'd love for you to be a part of it, as our **HR Business Partner,** directly supporting The Moving Division (**Hire a Helper and affiliates)**, some of the many companies in the Porch family!


The person we're looking for has had experience in all facets of HR, thrives in a fast-paced and challenging environment, has a passion for building and refining processes, and able to influence/mentor others. We need a HR partner who can build strong relationships with leaders and employees while balancing the need to be a strategic business partner along with a "roll up your sleeves" attitude. This person will work with high- level leadership teams and will provide strategic counsel in the areas of organizational design, leadership and manager development, and talent management. As a member of the HRBP team, you'll bring the experience, enthusiasm and attitude necessary to get the job done.

**What You Will Do**


â— **Assist in Talent Acquisition and Recruitment Process** by coordinating headcount needs, working with managers and leadership team on ensuring job descriptions are consistent in title, meet accounting and operations needs and leveled appropriately and assisting with reference and background checks pre-training start for US and International team members and


â— **Administer compensation and benefits plans for US and international employees** by coordinating with Payroll teams including on position changes, ensuring managers update accounting on payroll, answering benefits questions, reviewing and coordinating with benefits broker and ensuring accurate and timely entry of position changes


â— **Conduct employee onboarding and offboarding and help plan and execute training and development** by coordinating with IT and leadership on process, ensuring onboarding and offboarding checklist is completed, and tracking and processing team members


â— **Maintain the necessary HR documentation, tools, and processes** by updating and distributing policy notices, capturing comprehensive list of personnel, maintaining internal folders and records according to best practices, coordinating MYR and annual review process, conducting investigations and interviews as needed, able to train supervisors on state specific requirements


â— **Collaborate with business leadership, VP, People** and broader People team to establish HR plans and solutions to achieve strategic business initiatives and deliver results


â— **Partner with leaders at multiple levels and their teams to develop and execute People strategies** and activities that foster growth, innovation and organizational effectiveness. This includes implementing programs, processes and tools to help set managers and employees up for success


â— **Support the analysis and facilitation of leadership and cultural initiatives.** Use influence and coaching skills to cultivate a culture that reflects our core values. You assist with guiding business leadership on clarifying and executing business strategies for an assigned client; you identify areas for improving the clarity and effectiveness of strategy execution; you participate in the implementation of interventions


â— **Assess the human resources needs** in areas such as performance management, employee relations, compensation, career development and leadership development and drive the appropriate solutions in these areas


â— **Coach and counsel managers on maintaining positive employee relations** for a wide range of issues. May include conducting investigations in response to Employee Relations issues and working with VP, People to recommend/implement courses of action based on investigation results


â— **Act as liaison between employees and management** to answer questions or concerns regarding company policies, practices and regulations. You implement and adapt to new or changing structures (leadership or organizational), cultural change, or business-specific programs/processes (e.g., training, talent movement) for an assigned organization


â— **Lead the communication and rollout of HR programs and projects**


â— Perform other miscellaneous duties as assigned which may include cross-team initiatives across all U.S. locations and international locations

**What You Will Bring**


â— 7+ years of work experience with human resources processes or related (e.g., hiring, training, performance management)


â— OR Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business, or related field AND 4+ years of work experience with human resources or related processes (e.g., hiring, training, performance management)

**Additional Or Preferred Qualifications**


â— Master's Degree in Human Resources, Business, or related field.


â— 3+ years of experience partnering with Directors and/or Senior leaders in a fast pace call center or non-exempt employee environment

**What's Next?**

**Submit your application below and our Talent Acquisition team will be reviewing your application shortly! If your resume gets us intrigued, you can expect a call from us over the next couple business days. After that, we will invite you to another 2 or 3 video interviews. What's important to call out is that we want to make sure not only that you're the right person for us, but also that we're the right next step for you, so come prepared with all the questions you have!**


Porch

title: Recruiting Coordinator
description:
### **Description**


*Position at Confluent India Private Limited*
Confluent is pioneering a fundamentally new category of data infrastructure focused on data in motion. Have you ever found a new favourite series on Netflix, picked up groceries curbside at Walmart, or paid for something using Square? That’s the power of data in motion in action—giving organisations instant access to the massive amounts of data that is constantly flowing throughout their business. At Confluent, we’re building the foundational platform for this new paradigm of data infrastructure. Our cloud-native offering is designed to be the intelligent connective tissue enabling real-time data, from multiple sources, to constantly stream across the organisation. With Confluent, organisations can create a central nervous system to innovate and win in a digital-first world.  

We’re looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energised to roll up their sleeves and help realise Confluent’s enormous potential. Chart your own path and take healthy risks as we solve big problems together. We value having diverse teams and want you to grow as we grow—whether you’re just starting out in your career or managing a large team, you’ll be amazed at the magnitude of your impact. **About the Role:**  

Confluent is scaling rapidly and our Recruiting Coordinators play an integral role in how we grow our team. This is a great opportunity to partner with recruiters and hiring leaders across the company to help bring in top talent. In this role, you will learn foundational recruiting, HR and operations skills and impact one of the fastest growing start-ups in Silicon Valley. As a Recruiting Coordinator, you will work cross-functionally to provide a world-class candidate experience and act as an operations ambassador as we work to implement scalable processes.  

Confluent is scaling rapidly and our Recruiting Coordinators play an **What You Will Do:*** Coordinate a high volume of global interviews including virtually & onsite
* Partner with recruiting and business stakeholders to provide an exceptional candidate experience
* Track and update candidate status and interactions in our recruiting systems
* Partner with our People team to ensure smooth new hire onboarding including background checks
* **Candidate should be able to support either India or the EMEA region.**
* **Work location:- Bangalore and work mode would be Hybrid**

 **What You Will Bring:*** 5year(s) work experience as a recruiting coordinator (similar sectors are a plus)
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate within team structure
* Strong work ethic and sense of personal accountability
* High sense of urgency and effective time management skills
* Proficiency in GSuite

 **What Gives You an Edge:**
Knowledge of HR systems such as Jobvite / GoodTime / HireRight are preferable (but not essential) **Come As You Are**  

At Confluent, equality is a core tenet of our culture. We are committed to building an inclusive global team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences. The more diverse we are, the richer our community and the broader our impact. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.  

Click HERE to review our Candidate Privacy Notice which describes how and when Confluent, Inc., and its group companies, collects, uses, and shares certain personal information of California job applicants and prospective employees.

title: Lean Manager
description:
**Our Mission**
---------------


At infoAnalytica, we strive to delight our customers’ every day by a “Stand up, commit and deliver” team rather than a “Do the best you can” team.


**Growth at infoAnalytica**
---------------------------


* An opportunity to work with Fortune 500 Clients, serviced globally
* Learn from and work with experts and industry leaders
* Practices and Processes are backed by right resources and technologies
* Foster transparency and facilitate collaboration amongst our teams
* An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters growth
**Our Ethos**
-------------


* Own one’s work
* Do more with less
* Be Holistic, not myopic
* Earn trust and confidence
* Be a part of the solution, not the problem
* Impute
* Be a partner
* Deliver Results
* Pay attention to detail
* Focus on hiring and building grade A talent

  
**Some of the many benefits we provide our employees**
======================================================


Health Coverage For You & Your Family
In-House Gym
Training & Development Programs
In-House Cafe
Menstrual Leave Policy
  
### **Manager Leaning & Development (HR)**



InfoAnalytica Consulting provides critical market intelligence and valuable business insights to its global business clients. We have extensive expertise in Business & Financial Research and Analysis, Social Media Solutions, Marketing and Technology Consulting, and Content Development. Our clients include small, midsize and large (Fortune 500) companies in the U.S. and Europe. InfoAnalytica’ s philosophy is to provide actionable insights, solutions and content that deliver results in the applicable business space.



We understand the aspirations of our people, including prospective employees, and provide them with a conducive work environment and opportunities for growth in the research and consulting space.


### **Key responsibilities may include, but not limited to:**


* Helping the Company meet its objectives by conducting organizational needs analysis (technical, functional & soft skills), developing & implementing high impact learning & development programs/interventions in line with business needs and priorities to ensure that all employees have the required competencies to excel in their roles.
* Reviewing and revising course materials to ensure they are in line with operating processes, procedures, and systems.
* Developing content & delivering trainings (Soft Skills, Leadership, Communication, Interpersonal skills, Customer interactions, Writing skills, Motivation, Personal Effectiveness, TTT, etc.) to various parts of the business and working with various stakeholders to coordinate and organize training sessions.
* Collating feedback of completed training to evaluate and measure results and making improvements where required.
* Sourcing and recommending vendors and other external partners to design, develop, and / or deliver learning solutions where applicable**.**
* Implementing LMS & technology enabled innovations to support blended and digital learning.
* Coaching employees and helping them in applying training content to real life situations.
* Drive the employee engagement and employee communication initiatives to build a positive, cohesive & progressive work culture.

### **Ideal Profile:**


* 8-12 years of experience in a similar role with IT / ITES, KPO/BPO, Consulting companies
* Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact and build credibility across all levels of the organization.
* Strong networker & relationship builder
* Experience of implementing and managing LMS and Technology solutions
* Strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard
* Highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments

title: Administrative Officer
description:
Positions:
1
Location:
Bangalore Business Support Office  


Location - Bangalore/ Mumbai



Position - 1



At Gaiagen, we manufacture products that are biological alternatives to chemicals, in the field of pest management.



We are looking for an ambitious and energetic ‘**Sr. Officer - HR Admin & Safety’** to help us with HR administration, payroll management, Labour Contract Management, HR compliance and safety related work. This includes Updating internal payroll databases, coordination with the Payroll Partner, ensuring Statutory compliance related to HR & Factories Act and timely submission of returns, recruitments, addressing employee grievances related to payroll, PF, ESIC, Leaves etc., Management of Labour Contractors & Safety.


**Required Qualification:**



* MBA in Human Resources or relevant field.


* Minimum experience of 2-3 years in the field of Human Resources.


* Good communication skills in English and Hindi.


* Safety related certification will be an added advantage.
  


**Skills and Attributes:**



* Proven work experience as a Payroll Officer or similar role


* Hands-on experience with HRIS /accounting softwares/ MS Office/ G-suite.


* Strong math skills with an ability to spot numerical errors & good detailing.


* Good knowledge of labor legislations.


* Ability to handle confidential information.
  


**Job Description:**



* Compile relevant payroll data and Coordinate with the Payroll partner to ensure timely salary dispersals.


* MIS preparation and sharing relevant reports with the Finance Department.


* Ensure wages and tax withholdings comply with regulations.


* Ability to understand and help in designing compensation, benefits, taxes and insurance deductions.


* Adherence to labour related compliance with regard to Factories Act.


* Ensuring compliance with HR policies, and promoting effective communication within the organization.


* Preliminary screening for Recruitment.


* Organizing onboarding of new employees & Induction.


* Implementing HR policies and working with managers to ensure their enforcement.


* Manage Exit Formalities & Full & Final Calculations.


* Management of Labour Contractors and approval of bills and ensuring overall compliance.


* Visiting Government Departments based on requirement.


* Conduct Fire drills/ POSH Meetings/ Annual Medical Checkup as per requirements.


* Build relationships with key stakeholders.


* Handling Employee Grievances related to HR Administration (PF/ESIC/ Insurance).


* Building Safety Culture within the organization.
  


**Equality Statement:** Gaiagen is committed to building a diverse workplace. We invite applications from all persons, irrespective of gender, disabilities, and members of religious minorities groups who can contribute through their experience to the diversity and effectiveness of our workplace. Equality and diversity are core to our values as an organization. Staff members are expected to work collectively and individually to promote a constructive and sensitive approach to colleagues from different backgrounds, and value and respect their work.

  


**Conflict of Interest:** Public or other activity, affiliation to or support for any group or organization, personal association or other factor which may generate a real or perceived conflict of interest with our principles of independence and impartiality, or raise a security concern, or otherwise prevent the candidate from carrying out key functions of the specific post and would therefore disqualify the candidate from being appointed.

  


**Selection Process:**


* Shortlisting of candidates based on skills and experience
* Telephonic / Online interview
* Face to face interview

title: Senior Associate Engineer
description:
About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
Major Duties :1. Conducts feasibility studies, and defines and designs system requirements for complex data processing projects
2. Develops or maintains computer programs including designing, coding, testing, debugging,
and installation as needed
3. Prepares project phase reports, including requirements, feasibility, definition and design. May also review and validate requirements, definition and design to evaluate production impact and support requirements
4. Consults with partners from systems and other business units regarding new techniques, practices, or technologies in data processing and the impact of proposed and ongoing projects
5. Evaluates and makes recommendations on techniques, practices or technologies that would
enhance business needs. Also ensures continuous process improvements
6. Participates in strategic planning and long-range direction for technology in the business unit.
7. Acts as the technical or business consultant on project development/production health, new techniques and the implementation of new processes.
8. Able to serve as a key subject matter expert and mentor Analyst level employees
9. Works on projects and learning/refining project or process management skills
10. More technically sound in area of expertise and has broader knowledge of other areas
11. Delivers a work product that requires less revision
Knowledge :Knowledge of programming languages and various business applications, usually acquired
through related experience, is required to support all project phases. Knowledge of programming, debugging, and testing systems¿ programs is required to develop or maintain computer programs. Analytical and problem solving skills are needed for systems guidance.
Experience :A College or University degree in Computer Science and/or some relevant work experience is required
Working with Us:
As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.
Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.
We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater
Reasonable accommodation
Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com.
We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.
Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

title: Site Lead
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


In this role you will be responsible for wing-to-wing execution of projects to deliver high quality outcomes to internal and/or external customers. You will partner with functional owner to define requirements. You will work with teams internal and external to the initiative to ensure outcomes delivery on time, within scope and budget and of desired quality. You will ensure project management practices are followed and improved as needed. You will be responsible for nurturing university partnerships, to enhance employer branding, drive employee engagement, provide comprehensive executive assistance, facilitate global communication, and managing schedules efficiently. You will assist in preparing presentations, reports, and other documents for internal and external meetings.**Job Description**
===================

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with business and functional partners and leadership in specifying requirements
* Drive external university and academic partnerships
* Define execution plan and approach based on project scope, expected timeline and available budget/resources
* Work with teams often comprising of members of separate organizations to coordinate day-to-day execution as per outlined plan
* Cooperate with and manage external vendors as required
* Ensure pre-defined project management processes and practices are followed. Drive simplification and improvement as necessary
* Support execution team with resolution of roadblocks and interdependencies. Partner with functional teams external to the project to ensure their tasks are completed as required
* Manage project risks, scope changes and other non-standard events throughout the life of the project
* Manage stakeholder communication and progress reporting
* Ensure quality of deliverables is verified and matching stakeholder expectations.

* **University Relations:**


	+ Develop and maintain partnerships with universities, including faculty members, career services offices, and student organizations.
	+ Organize and events and networking sessions to promote our organization and opportunities available.
	+ Collaborate with academic institutions to develop internship programs, co-op opportunities, and other talent acquisition initiatives.
* **Employer Branding:**


	+ Strategize and execute internal communication plans to enhance our employer brand among current employees.
	+ Develop and manage employer branding materials, including employee testimonials, videos, and social media content.
	+ Work closely with marketing and HR teams to ensure brand consistency and alignment with organizational values.
* **Employee Engagement:**


	+ Plan and execute a variety of engagement activities, such as team-building events, wellness programs, and recognition initiatives.
	+ Solicit feedback from employees to continuously improve engagement strategies and initiatives.
	+ Foster a positive and inclusive work culture that values diversity and promotes collaboration.
* **Executive Assistance:**


	+ Provide administrative support to senior management, including calendar management, travel arrangements, and meeting coordination.
	+ Connect, network and collaborate with leaders across the globe to ensure no bottlenecks in communication and schedule planning.
	+ Assist in preparing presentations, excel reports, and other documents for internal and external meetings.
	+ Handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.

**Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Human Resources, Marketing, or related field.
* MBA will be good to have, but not necessary.
* 4-8 years’ experience
* Proven experience in university relations, employer branding, or employee engagement roles.
* Strong communication, networking, and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management abilities, with keen attention to detail.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Presentation and Excel primarily) and experience with social media platforms.
* Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

**Desired Characteristics**

* Team player – collaborates well with others to solve problems and actively incorporates input from various sources
* Demonstrated customer focus – evaluates decisions through the eyes of the customer, builds strong customer relationships, creates processes with customer viewpoint and partners with customers to help shape their future initiatives
* Strong analytical and strong problem solving skills -communicates in a clear and succinct manner and effectively evaluates information / data to make decisions, anticipates obstacles and develops plans to resolve, creates actionable strategies and operational plans
* Change oriented – actively generates process improvements, champions and drives change initiatives, confronts difficult circumstances in creative ways, balances multiple and competing priorities and executes accordingly

**Inclusion and Diversity**


GE HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.


We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.


Our **total rewards** are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No

title: Delivery Driver
description:
* Pune, India
* DOP SLH
* 3059852
**Job Description**
-------------------

***Role Purpose***


*The purpose of this role is to increase revenue, maximize process efficiency & cost-effectiveness, and ensure excellent customer experience, through effective leadership and supervision of daily operations and personnel, strategy planning, contract compliance, resource optimization and capability development for an account.*  



***Do***


* **Maximize process efficiency and cost effectiveness through strategic planning, contract compliance and governance mechanisms**
	+ *Strategy Planning with Senior Stakeholders & Clients*
		- Collaborate with leaders to provide strategic and operational plans associated with the account
	
		- Plan the strategy for the coming years by identifying new geographies for alternate revenue streams
* Collaborate with clients and identify countries that need to be mapped to bring revenues for the same product

* Part of internal WIPRO leadership planning meeting to discuss revenue numbers for the account


* Report to global delivery account head on status of the account


* *Ensure a deep enough understanding of clients’ individual experiences to head off potential issues before they become problems*
* *Contract compliance & adherence*
	+ Ensure all SLA parameters are met in the account and maintain a green card at all times

	+ Review and drive appropriate actions/ systemic changes on internal and external audit findings to ensure no major non-compliances are cited
* Monitor and review the account on various delivery parameters to ensure quality delivery as per budget and timelines

* *Delivery governance in the account*
	+ Understand customer goals and key performance metrics and ensure exceeding those goals throughout the project

	+ Ensure a green card for all accounts in terms of performance and quality
* Monitor and review delivery dashboards/ MIS across accounts to track progress and identify potential red flags

* Participate and share account performance across operational, quality and fulfillment parameters with internal and external stakeholders


* Lead and manage project escalations, potential risks or early warning signs on project delivery to eliminate any revenue leakage


* Ensure regular invoicing as per the contract terms and condition
* Forecast and track key account metrics

* *Invoicing*

	+ Timely submission of invoices to the client as defined in the SOW
	+ Provide information required and resolve any invoicing issues raised by the clien*t*
* *Work with internal teams by supporting activities such as RFP response, doing use capability demonstrations, and participating in the customer calls to sell solutions*


* *Identify opportunities for quick wins through automation and related initiatives in the account (wherever applicable)*


* *Collect and analyze statistics (costs, customer service metrics etc.)*


* *Assume responsibility of budgeting and tracking expenses*

  

* **Ensure outstanding performance against key metrics mentioned in the agreement**

	+ *Regular cadence around contract compliance*
	
		- *Evaluate performance with key metrics (accuracy, customer service metrics etc.)*
		- Set direction for the team, track progress against targets through regular cadence calls and course correct as required
* Drive the focus of the team on quality and adherence to contract compliance processes

* Drive and implement structured cadence around quality, both process and transactional


* Cadence with delivery lead to ensure margins are met and the account numbers are at par to what is committed


* Weekly calls with WFM to ensure resource optimization, compliance to the manpower numbers agreed in the contract, future planning in case of ramp ups etc.


* *Resource Allocation & Retention*

	+ Conduct effective resource planning to maximize the productivity of resources (people, technology etc.)

	+ Review and monitor resource planning and fulfillment in line with account requirements and costs of delivery
* Optimize manpower and minimize leakages by working closely with delivery head

* Ensure retention by offering relevant trainings and certifications of all allocated resources


* Lead one-on-one floor connect and other engagement activities to improve stickiness of the delivery team


* *Collaborate and influence internal key stakeholders to manage and resolve issues to ensure fulfillment and flawless delivery of projects*
  

* **Build people capability to ensure superior customer service levels of the existing account/client**


* *Develop Capability within service line and products as per account requirements*


* *Lead capability development initiatives to drive client specific certifications*
* *Co-create capability enhancement programs with client for front line staff and supervisory level*


* *Work with the Training and HR team to build and review training calendar*


* *Ensure customer-dedicated (as a result of change in process/tool), guaranteed trainings are conducted for the employees in the areas of skill development, soft skill and leadership training*
* *Ensure team KPIs are assigned & delivered with timeliness & accuracy keeping the end results in mind*


* *Partner with HR and Training teams to build training programs for front line staff/engineers and the supervisory level*


* *Focus on helping people develop their careers in order to retain people in the account and reduce turnover*
  

* **Stakeholder Interaction & Management**
	+ *Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance and quality in the delivery for accounts*

	+ *Interact and engage with the client leadership to communicate and update progress against account plan, project delivery etc.*
	+ *Connect with senior leadership monthly on updating on the progress on a particular account*

	+ *Conduct monthly client connects to get feedback from client on the services provided as well as update the clients on the progress on the account*

	+ *Cadence with delivery lead to ensure margins are met and the account numbers are at par to what is committed*
	+ *Participate in monthly review meetings with WIPRO leadership updating them on the status and progress of each account*

	+ *Work with quality team to ensure the current business is as per the delivery standards of the contract*

	+ *Weekly calls with WFM to ensure resource optimization, compliance to the manpower numbers agreed, future planning in case of ramp ups etc.*

	+ *Provide timely assistance in case of an escalation and support resolution of escalations/ issues*
* **Effective Team Management**

	+ *Resourcing*
	
		- Hire adequate and right resources for the team
	+ *Talent Management*
	
		- Ensure adequate onboarding and training for the team members to enhance capability & effectiveness
	
		- Build an internal talent pool and ensure their career progression within the organization
* Manage team attrition

* Drive diversity in leadership positions


* *Performance Management*

	+ Set goals for the team, conduct timely performance reviews and provide constructive feedback to own direct reports

	+ Ensure that the Performance Nxt is followed for the entire team
* *Employee Satisfaction and Engagement*

	+ Lead and drive engagement initiatives for the team

	+ Track team satisfaction scores and identify initiatives to build engagement within the team
***Stakeholder Interaction***

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
* Full-time

**Company Description**
-----------------------


Founded in the year 2007, Abhibus Services (India) Private Limited is a pioneer in providing end-to-end software and other value added solutions for bus transport Industry by leveraging the latest Technology of today. Abhibus aims to be the most preferred Information Technology partner for the State Transport Corporations and private Bus Fleet Operators.  

Abhibus is the only company in India that specializes in providing Online Reservation System Solutions for the Indian Bus Transport Industry. Abhibus has been in the fore-front of providing end-to-end software solutions and services to the bus industry in our country.

-------------------

* Manage office floor and all facilities thereof to maintain a smoothly-functioning workplace
* Ensuring a clean, healthy and conducive work environment for employees
* Responsible for all office operations, administration, maintenance and security
* Manage works related to electricity, water, furniture, building maintenance
* Manage office parking spaces / cabs / organize rides for employees, if needed
* Manage construction workers / repair workers for all office furnishings
* Ensure timely opening / closing of office facilities
* Manage office peons, security and support staff
* Liaise with building administration office for all office premises related tasks
* Maintenance of pantry / common areas
* Stock-keeping, procurement and replenishment of office supplies / pantry supplies
* External field work with vendors / partners / customers.
* Resolution of any disputes with workers / building administration
* Collection of feedback from office staff for improvement of office facilities
* Liaising with Government Authorities & Offices if required
* Liaising with HR, Finance, Business Development & Sales team for all their operational needs.
* Manage the administration of contracts and agreements to ensure compliance with terms and conditions and to monitor supplier performance.
* Responsible for Vendor Management & Development, Soft Services,
* Space Management, Asset Management, Space allocation, Guesthouse Management, Warehouse management, Transport, Travel Desk, Hotel Accommodation, Telecommunications, Mailroom, Printing & Stationery, Pest control, Event Management, Cafeteria Management.
* Ensuring the office is operational in the stipulated timeline.
* Ensuring employees are well accommodated in a workplace that supports
**Qualifications**
------------------

* 4-5 years experience in office administration / operations with professional organizations
* Good communication skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
* Ability to prepare and update MIS / Budgets / Reports
* Good network among suppliers and vendors for office administration
* Process oriented and systematic work style
* Ability to manage, negotiate and interface with external vendors
* Coordination and management skills
* Initiative Taking Ability & Creativity
* Sharp perception and Eye for Detail

title: Lead Project Manager
description:
**\\_VOIS Intro**
----------------

**About \\_VOIS:**

  

\\_VO**IS** (Vodafone Intelligent Solutions) is a strategic arm of Vodafone Group Plc, creating value and enhancing quality and efficiency across 28 countries, and operating from 7 locations: Albania, Egypt, Hungary, India, Romania, Spain and the UK.

  

Over 29,000 highly skilled individuals are dedicated to being Vodafone Group’s partner of choice for talent, technology, and transformation. We deliver the best services across IT, Business Intelligence Services, Customer Operations, Business Operations, HR, Finance, Supply Chain, HR Operations, and many more.

  

Established in 2006, \\_VO**IS** has evolved into a global, multi-functional organisation, a Centre of Excellence for Intelligent Solutions focused on adding value and delivering business outcomes for Vodafone.

**\\_VOIS Centre Intro**
-----------------------

**About \\_VOIS India:**

  

In 2009, \\_VO**IS** started operating in India and now has established global delivery centres in Pune, Bangalore and Ahmedabad. With more than 14,500 employees, \\_VO**IS** India supports global markets and group functions of Vodafone, and delivers best-in-class customer experience through multi-functional services in the areas of Information Technology, Networks, Business Intelligence and Analytics, Digital Business Solutions (Robotics & AI), Commercial Operations (Consumer & Business), Intelligent Operations, Finance Operations, Supply Chain Operations and HR Operations and more.

**Job Role Related Content (Role specific)**
--------------------------------------------

**\\_VOIS Equal Opportunity Employer Commitment**
------------------------------------------------

**India:**

  



\\_VO**IS** is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We celebrate differences and we welcome and value diverse people and insights. We believe that being authentically human and inclusive powers our employees’ growth and enables them to create a positive impact on themselves and society. We do not discriminate based on age, colour, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

  

As a result of living and breathing our commitment, our employees have helped us get certified as a Great Place to Work in India for four years running. We have been also highlighted among the **Top 5 Best Workplaces for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**, **Top 10 Best Workplaces for Women**, **Top 25 Best Workplaces in IT & IT-BPM** and **14th Overall Best Workplaces in India** by the Great Place to Work Institute in 2023. These achievements position us among a select group of trustworthy and high-performing companies which put their employees at the heart of everything they do.

  

By joining us, you are part of our commitment. We look forward to welcoming you into our family which represents a variety of cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and skills!

title: Desktop Support Technician
description:
At Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet. That’s why we need smart, committed people to join us. Whether you’re looking to start your career or make a change, talk to us and see how you can elevate the power of your work at Iron Mountain.


We provide expert, sustainable solutions in records and information management, digital transformation services, data centers, asset lifecycle management, and fine art storage, handling, and logistics. We proudly partner every day with our 225,000 customers around the world to preserve their invaluable artifacts, extract more from their inventory, and protect their data privacy in innovative and socially responsible ways.


Are you curious about being part of our growth story while evolving your skills in a culture that will welcome your unique contributions? If so, let's start the conversation.


We are looking for a **Desktop Support Engineer** who is responsible for providing technical assistance and support to end-users for their computer hardware, software, and network-related issues. Given IM has many remote Warehouses within India & across APAC, we also expect the engineer to learn & grow into IT Field Support engineer who with Engineers be able to travel to provide Hands & Feet support. This engineer with appropriate training & guidance should be able scale up to demands to visit Iron Mountain Data Centers & Warehouses to RACK Servers, Routers, Switches, Patch panels & related stuff.


**Roles & Responsibilities:**


* **User Assistance** : - Provide prompt and courteous support to end-users, addressing hardware and software-related concerns and troubleshooting issues. Should be able to monitor Ticket queues & provide resolutions within stipulated SLA.
* **On-site Support** : - Provide on-site assistance for the installation, configuration, and maintenance of computer systems, servers, and network devices.
* **Desktop Setup and Configuration:** - Install, configure, and deploy desktop computers, laptops, Printer and peripherals, ensuring they meet organizational standards.
* **Software Installation and Updates:** - Install, update, and troubleshoot software applications, ensuring compatibility and adherence to licensing agreements.
* **Hardware Troubleshooting:** - Diagnose and resolve hardware issues, such as malfunctioning components or peripherals, to maintain a reliable computing environment and printer.
* **Operating System Support:** - Provide support for operating systems (e.g., Windows, macOS), including installation, configuration, and troubleshooting.
* **User Account Management:** - Manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls, ensuring security and compliance with organizational policies.
* **Remote Support:** - Offer remote assistance to end-users using various support tools, resolving issues efficiently without requiring physical presence.
* Should be able to work closely with Network Engineers & to follow Network Diagrams to be able to setup Networks at remote sites. Should be all to physically RACK Servers, Nutanix, NW devices such as Firewalls, Routers, Switches, Patch Panels & related to get the Network stood up at remote sites.
* **Email and Communication Support:** - Assist with email setup, configuration, and troubleshooting, ensuring seamless communication for end-users.
* **Security Measures:** - Implement and enforce security measures, including antivirus updates and malware removal, to safeguard desktop systems.
* **Backup and Recovery:** - Execute backup and recovery procedures to protect user data and ensure business continuity in case of system failures.
* **Collaboration with IT Teams:** - Work collaboratively with other IT teams, such as network administrators and system administrators, to address complex issues and ensure overall system stability.
* **Documentation:** - Maintain accurate documentation of support activities, troubleshooting steps, and resolutions for future reference and knowledge sharing.
* **IT Asset Management** :- Manage and track IT assets, including inventory management, ensuring proper disposal of obsolete equipment and adherence to asset management policies.
* **Responsible for Onboarding and Offboarding** : Coordinate with onboarding & HR team to ensure onboarding & offboarding tasks are completed
* **Responsible for AV system** : Providing basic support on video conferencing call setup and Vendor coordination in case of problems in VC equipment or set-up
* **Collaborate with vendors and service providers** to resolve technical issues and coordinate repairs and Troubleshooting printer / scanner related issues at users desktop/laptop and reporting hardware issues to vendors

**Requirements and skills:**


* **1-5 years of relevant experience as a Desktop Support Engineer** .
* Should be flexible to work in **rotational shifts including US, Europe & India time zones**
* Should be flexible to travel to Iron Mountain Warehouses both within India & APAC.
* **Excellent written & oral communication** in **English** & local languages, with professional articulation skills required for interacting with customers.
* Knowledge of network security practices and anti-virus programs
* Experience using **ITSM tools such as Service now.**
* Good understanding of G suite product
* Experience in supporting Win8, 10, macOS, iOS and Android Product.
* ITIL v4 Foundation certification (nice to have)
* Excellent problem-solving and multitasking skills
* Customer-oriented attitude
* Experience in handling basic audits
* Knowledge of IP network, DNS, DHCP, WAN, LAN and experience with troubleshooting all aspects of wired and wireless configuration.
* Having experience with Google workspace, Cisco Switching & Routing and OKTA will **be an advantage.**
* Certification in such as CCNA would **be a plus**
* Diploma or Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology or a related field

Category: Information Technology


Iron Mountain is a global leader in storage and information management services trusted by more than 225,000 organizations in 60 countries. We safeguard billions of our customers’ assets, including critical business information, highly sensitive data, and invaluable cultural and historic artifacts. Take a look at our history here.


Iron Mountain helps lower cost and risk, comply with regulations, recover from disaster, and enable digital and sustainable solutions, whether in information management, digital transformation, secure storage and destruction, data center operations, cloud services, or art storage and logistics. Please see our Values and Code of Ethics for a look at our principles and aspirations in elevating the power of our work together.


If you have a physical or mental disability that requires special accommodations, please let us know by sending an email to accommodationrequest@ironmountain.com. See the Supplement to learn more about Equal Employment Opportunity.


Iron Mountain is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit and hire applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, or any other factor prohibited by law.


To view the Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law posters and the supplement, as well as the Pay Transparency Policy Statement, CLICK HERE


**Requisition:** J0071753

title: Associate
description:
* Mumbai, India
* DOP
* 3055495
**Job Description**
-------------------

**Role Purpose**

  



*The purpose of the role is to provide effective technical support to the process and actively resolve client issues directly or through timely escalation to meet process SLAs.*


**Do**


* **Support process by managing transactions as per required quality standards**

	+ *Fielding all incoming help requests from clients via telephone and/or emails in a courteous manner*

	+ *Document all pertinent end user identification information, including name, department, contact information and nature of problem or issue*

	+ *Update own availability in the RAVE system to ensure productivity of the process*

	+ *Record, track, and document all queries received, problem- solving steps taken and total successful and unsuccessful resolutions*
	+ *Follow standard processes and procedures to resolve all client queries*

	+ *Resolve client queries as per the SLA’s defined in the contract*
	+ *Access and maintain internal knowledge bases, resources and frequently asked questions to aid in and provide effective problem resolution to clients*

	+ *Identify and learn appropriate product details to facilitate better client interaction and troubleshooting*
	+ *Document and analyze call logs to spot most occurring trends to prevent future problems*

	+ *Maintain and update self-help documents for customers to speed up resolution time*

	+ *Identify red flags and escalate serious client issues to Team leader in cases of untimely resolution*

	+ *Ensure all product information and disclosures are given to clients before and after the call/email requests*

	+ *Avoids legal challenges by complying with service agreements*
  

* **Deliver excellent customer service through effective diagnosis and troubleshooting of client queries**

	+ *Provide product support and resolution to clients by performing a question diagnosis while guiding users through step-by-step solutions*
	+ *Assist clients with navigating around product menus and facilitate better understanding of product features*
	+ *Troubleshoot all client queries in a user-friendly, courteous and professional manner*

	+ *Maintain logs and records of all customer queries as per the standard procedures and guidelines*

	+ *Accurately process and record all incoming call and email using the designated tracking software*

	+ *Offer alternative solutions to clients (where appropriate) with the objective of retaining customers’ and clients’ business*
	+ *Organize ideas and effectively communicate oral messages appropriate to listeners and situations*

	+ *Follow up and make scheduled call backs to customers to record feedback and ensure compliance to contract /SLAs*
* **Build capability to ensure operational excellence and maintain superior customer service levels of the existing account/client**
	+ *Undertake product trainings to stay current with product features, changes and updates*

	+ *Enroll in product specific and any other trainings per client requirements/recommendations*

	+ *Partner with team leaders to brainstorm and identify training themes and learning issues to better serve the client*

	+ *Update job knowledge by participating in self learning opportunities and maintaining personal networks*

Lists the competencies required to perform this role effectively:

**Competency Levels**

  

  

**Foundation**

  

Knowledgeable about the competency requirements. Demonstrates (in parts) frequently with minimal support and guidance.

  

  

**Competent**

  

Consistently demonstrates the full range of the competency without guidance. Extends the competency to difficult and unknown situations as well.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer (Remote)**

**Experience:** 3+ years

**Salary:** INR 2,16,500 - 3,50,000 / month

**Expected Notice Period**: 2 to 4 Weeks

**Shift**: 11:00AM to 7:00PM IST

**Opportunity Type:** Remote

**Placement Type:** Permanent

**(\\*Note: This is a requirement for one of Uplers' clients)**

**What do you need for this opportunity?**

**Primary Skills**:

Team Collaboration, Data Modeling, ETL, Snowflake, PostgreSQL, Problem Solving Attitude, Python, SQL, Strong Attention To Detail

**Assessment:** 

Role based AI Screening covering Communication and Technical Skills

**Our Hiring Partner is Looking for:**

Data Engineer (Remote) who is passionate about their work, eager to learn and grow, and who is committed to delivering exceptional results. If you are a team player, with a positive attitude and a desire to make a difference, then we want to hear from you.

**Roles & Responsibilities**

**Who We Are:**

Our data engineering team is focused on delivering TripAdvisor’s first-in-class data products that serve all data users across the organization. As a member of the Data Platform Enterprise Services Team, you will collaborate with engineering and business stakeholders to build, optimize, maintain, and secure the full data vertical including tracking instrumentation, information architecture, ETL pipelines, and tooling that provide key analytics insights for business-critical decisions at the highest levels of Product, Finance, Sales, CRM, Marketing, Data Science, and more. All in a dynamic environment of continuously modernizing tech stack including highly scalable architecture, cloud-based infrastructure, and real-time responsiveness.

We take pride in our data engineering and are looking for a talented and highly-motivated engineer with a passion for solving interesting problems to add to our high-performing team.

**What You'll Do:**

* Providing the organization’s data consumers high quality data sets by data curation, consolidation, and manipulation from a wide variety of large scale (terabyte and growing) sources.
* Building first-class data products and ETL processes that interact with terabytes of data on leading platforms such as Snowflake and BigQuery.
* Developing and improving Foundational datasets by creating efficient and scalable data models to be used across the organization.
* Working with our Data Science, Analytics, CRM, and Machine Learning teams.
* Responsible for the data pipelines’ SLA and dependency management.
* Writing technical documentation for data solutions, and presenting at design reviews.
* Solving data pipeline failure events and implementing anomaly detection.

**Engagement Type:**

* Payroll and Compliance to be managed by: KaamWork
* Client / Talent Agreement - Full-time Permanent position
* Kaamwork is the on-the-ground HR partner managing services like talent sourcing, employment contracts, payroll, and compliance. Kaamwork serves as the Employer of Record while Trip manages all work-related decisions and operations.

**Project Requirements:**

**Education**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

**Work Experience**

* 3 to 6 years data engineering experience

**Tech Experience**

* Experience with technologies and toolings associated with relational databases (PostgreSQL or equivalent) and data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop/Hive, or equivalent).
* Experience with writing and optimizing SQL
* Experience with data modeling and ETL/ELT design, including defining SLAs, performance measurements, tuning and monitoring.
* Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets
* Experience with programming languages such as Python, Java and/or Scala
* Knowledge of cloud data warehouse concepts

**Communication/people skills**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
* Ability to make progress on projects independently and enthusiasm for solving difficult problems

**Interview Process**

All candidates will go through TA’s greenhouse process. We should try to find resources from Affine first.

* Resume review
* Initial screen
* Technical
* Culture Fit/Soft Skills

**How to apply for this opportunity?**

* Register or login on our portal & fill out the application
* Clear the given AI Screening (30 min) and Click on ‘Apply’ to get shortlisted
* Our team of talent matchmakers will matchmake you with the client
* Crack a quick interview with our client
* Land your global dream job and get your exciting career started!

**About our Hiring Partner:**

Tripadvisor, the world's largest travel guidance platform\\*, helps hundreds of millions of people each month\\*\\* become better travelers, from planning to booking to taking a trip. Travelers across the globe use the Tripadvisor site and app to discover where to stay, what to do and where to eat based on guidance from those who have been there before. With more than 1 billion reviews and opinions of nearly 8 million businesses, travelers turn to Tripadvisor to find deals on accommodations, book experiences, reserve tables at delicious restaurants and discover great places nearby. As a travel guidance company available in 43 markets and 22 languages, Tripadvisor makes planning easy no matter the trip type.

**About Uplers:**

Our goal is to make hiring reliable, simple, and fast. Our role will be to help all our talents find and apply for relevant opportunities and progress in their career. We will support any grievances or challenges you may face during the engagement. You will also be assigned to a dedicated Talent Success Coach during the engagement.

(**Note:** There are many more opportunities apart from this on the portal. Depending on the assessments you clear, you can apply for them as well).

So, if you are ready for a new challenge, a great work environment, and an opportunity to take your career to the next level, don't hesitate to apply today. We are waiting for you!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: ₹216,500.00 - ₹350,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Work from home

Work Location: Remote

title: Vice President of Programs
description:
***With a startup spirit and 115,000 + curious and courageous minds, we have the expertise to go deep with the world’s biggest brands—and we have fun doing it! We dream in digital, dare in reality, and reinvent the ways companies work to make an impact far bigger than just our bottom line. We’re harnessing the power of technology and humanity to create meaningful transformation that moves us forward in our pursuit of a world that works better for people.******Now, we’re calling upon the thinkers and doers, those with a natural curiosity and a hunger to keep learning, keep growing. People who thrive on fearlessly experimenting, seizing opportunities, and pushing boundaries to turn our vision into reality. And as you help us create a better world, we will help you build your own intellectual firepower.******Welcome to the relentless pursuit of better.******Inviting applications for the role of Assistant Vice President- Program Lead - Leadership Development******Leadership development has been Genpact’s legacy and aligned to our employee value proposition – Learn, Grow, Succeed. We are focused on strengthening our leadership talent pool by building strong, dynamic leaders internally, leaders who can contribute to the organization’s vision and lead it into the future. Our programs are delivered through innovative learning methodologies, world-class mentoring, opportunities to work on high impact projects, networking etc. Our programs have consistently been recognized and awarded in the last 15 years.******This role will work closely with senior leaders across the business to establish a leadership development strategy and deliver ‘best in class’ learning experiences for leaders globally.******Responsibilities:******The Program Lead – Leadership Development will have two parts to their role (1) be responsible for end-to-end program management of our leadership programs and (2) overall talent development dashboarding and communication.**** ***Redesign & realign the existing leadership development programs with the new strategy in line with the company’s business imperatives and other talent mandates.***

* ***Leverage new age learning practices, methods, frameworks & measures to design and deliver new format of leadership development program and comprehensive evaluation strategies.***

* ***Ensure end-to-end implementation of existing leadership programs… Leadership Direct (LDP), Executive Development Program (EDP), Global Integrations Workshop (GIW).***

* ***Partner with the existing Genome learning ecosystem and business L&D teams / academies to ensure alignment of leadership programs to overall learning architecture and design principles.***

* ***Co-facilitate learning sessions with Gurus, Master Gurus, and external facilitators.***

* ***Seek regular feedback from all stakeholders including participants, their supervisors, HR & Leaders to improve consistently on the program effectiveness.***

* ***Collaborate effectively with the team to produce outstanding results in program execution,***

* ***learner engagement, branding & communication and reporting and analytics.***

* ***Lead the monthly publication and communication plan for the overall Talent Development function.***

***Qualifications we seek in you!***
====================================

***Minimum Qualifications/skills******Relevant experience in building and scaling leadership development programs for an organization******Comfortable in a dynamic environment, and can balance setting long-term strategic priorities with high-quality, tactical execution.******Possess operational rigor, detail orientation, strong problem-solving skills, and analytical capability.******Strong influencing skills and can engage with business leaders and partners thoughtfully and successfully.******Excellent verbal and written skills; able to package and present complex analysis and recommendations clearly.******Well-versed in digital learning, just-in-time/micro-learning, and blended learning strategies******Experience as a Trainer / Facilitator***
***Preferred Qualifications/ Skills******MBA, Qualification in organizational psychology or in any other similar discipline***
***WIIFM******Opportunity to******Work closely with the top leadership of the company******Partner with world’s best leadership development organizations & consultants******Stay ahead of the curve on the latest in domain, digital and leadership skills @ Genpact******Receive global exposure******Be a part of industry recognized programs***
***Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.*** ***Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. For more information, visit*** ***www.genpact.com*** ***. Follow us on*** ***Twitter******,*** ***Facebook******,*** ***LinkedIn******, and*** ***YouTube******.******Furthermore, please do note that Genpact does not charge fees to process job applications and applicants are not required to pay to participate in our hiring process in any other way. Examples of such scams include purchasing a 'starter kit,' paying to apply, or purchasing equipment or training.***

title: Deputy Manager
description:
**\\_VOIS Intro**
----------------

**About \\_VOIS:**

  

\\_VO**IS** (Vodafone Intelligent Solutions) is a strategic arm of Vodafone Group Plc, creating value and enhancing quality and efficiency across 28 countries, and operating from 7 locations: Albania, Egypt, Hungary, India, Romania, Spain and the UK.

  

Over 29,000 highly skilled individuals are dedicated to being Vodafone Group’s partner of choice for talent, technology, and transformation. We deliver the best services across IT, Business Intelligence Services, Customer Operations, Business Operations, HR, Finance, Supply Chain, HR Operations, and many more.

  

Established in 2006, \\_VO**IS** has evolved into a global, multi-functional organisation, a Centre of Excellence for Intelligent Solutions focused on adding value and delivering business outcomes for Vodafone.

**\\_VOIS Centre Intro**
-----------------------

**About \\_VOIS India:**

  

In 2009, \\_VO**IS** started operating in India and now has established global delivery centres in Pune, Bangalore and Ahmedabad. With more than 14,500 employees, \\_VO**IS** India supports global markets and group functions of Vodafone, and delivers best-in-class customer experience through multi-functional services in the areas of Information Technology, Networks, Business Intelligence and Analytics, Digital Business Solutions (Robotics & AI), Commercial Operations (Consumer & Business), Intelligent Operations, Finance Operations, Supply Chain Operations and HR Operations and more.

**Job Role Related Content (Role specific)**
--------------------------------------------

* 5-8 years of experience in Application deployment and maintenance in WebLogic, OSM,ASAP,UIM, SQL/PLSQL, Java and Unix/Shell Scripting.
* In-depth understanding of PIP Cartridge deployment.
* In-depth understanding of ASDL and CSDL.
* Hands-on Knowledge on Nwt. Elements and ASAP commands.
* Domain knowledge of telecom
* Installation, configuration, deployment, and Upgrade of OSM (SOM & COM), UIM and ASAP and WebLogic server
**\\_VOIS Equal Opportunity Employer Commitment**
------------------------------------------------

  

\\_VO**IS** is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We celebrate differences and we welcome and value diverse people and insights. We believe that being authentically human and inclusive powers our employees’ growth and enables them to create a positive impact on themselves and society. We do not discriminate based on age, colour, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

  

As a result of living and breathing our commitment, our employees have helped us get certified as a Great Place to Work in India for four years running. We have been also highlighted among the **Top 5 Best Workplaces for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**, **Top 10 Best Workplaces for Women**, **Top 25 Best Workplaces in IT & IT-BPM** and **14th Overall Best Workplaces in India** by the Great Place to Work Institute in 2023. These achievements position us among a select group of trustworthy and high-performing companies which put their employees at the heart of everything they do.

  

By joining us, you are part of our commitment. We look forward to welcoming you into our family which represents a variety of cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and skills!

 **Apply now, and we’ll be in touch!**

title: Team Leader, Investment Solutions
description:
Hello.
We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.  

With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.  

In Workplace Solutions (WPS) our unique contribution will accelerate Haleon’s success by transforming the employee experience, inspiring everyone to be their best wherever they work.  

WPS team is responsible for the full lifecycle of planning, execution, Real Estate/Facilities management and operations of Haleon’s real estate portfolio consisting of complex R&D facilities, office buildings, and sales office sites. The sites may be owned, leased, or be occupied through a serviced space arrangement. WPS works in close collaboration with our Global Support Function partners (Tech, HR, EHS, Legal etc) and relies extensively on our network of vendor partners to deliver a safe, productive, and desirable work environment for all users of our sites.  

This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.  

Role Overview  

The WPS Lead for India role, part of the APAC Procurement Centre of Excellence (COE) organization, will be responsible for all category management and sourcing activities for Workplace Solutions within India.  

This role is responsible for development and delivery of the E2E real estate, capital improvement and facilities management strategy at all WPS locations within India ensuring business needs, cost, quality, and compliance metrics are achieved.  

The role supports the business with their E2E (Real Estate/Facilities to operations to supplier performance) cycle of facilities and real estate, and it is required to deliver a coherent, joined up approach to employee experience and aligning to their customers business strategy. This role acts as a business partner to the Regional QSC leadership, BU GMs along with the Finance leadership and is required to manage and influence many senior stakeholders within the region.  

This is a high impact, high complexity role with significant scope that spans across multiple areas and suppliers  

In this role you will…* Act as the POC for any Workplace Solutions related topics to the India BU lead.
* Work within the APAC Procurement COE team to strategically develop and evolve WPS strategy for the business for all sites within this region.
* Understand & monitor asset performance against business requirements and suggest suitable interventions to solve any gaps.
* Establish and develop external relationships in the region, to optimize WPS operations, real estate, and capital services to best serve our employees and business units.
* The role is required to manage & influence many senior stakeholders' region-wide.
* Develop and grow a diverse professional team of 3rd party providers accountable for the delivery of a world class end to end Real Estate and Facilities function within assigned Business Unit(s).
* Work closely with cross-functional (e.g. HR, Tech, procurement team etc to ensure WPS's services are integrated as part of a joined up, cohesive approach to employee experience.
* Assume full accountability for the delivery of OPEX and CAPEX budgets, ensuring financial acumen across their organization and responsibility for budget delivery with their reporting WPS Business Unit and Site Leads.
* Responsible for local delivery of all facilities and services within assigned Business Unit, ensuring cost, quality and compliance targets are achieved by key contract partners.
* Develop and embed contract governance processes and structures to ensure value and delivery in the Service provider contracts, and to ensure effective risk management controls are in place.
* Accountable for the prioritization and delivery of a program of capital projects (including minor works, infrastructure, business driven and energy projects) for assigned Business Unit, working closely with the Real Estate and Capital leads and managing 3rd party project managers.
* Align business needs and lead real estate transaction activities for assigned Business Unit in partnership with the Real Estate and Capital leads.
* Lead the onboarding of new sites into WPS management, ensuring thorough due diligence, solution development and service integration.
* Validate performance reporting and to ensure appropriate metrics are delivered by the service providers to key internal stakeholders.
* Uphold and ensure compliance with internal HALEON policies, standards, procedures, alerts and relevant external regulatory requirements with respect to Quality, Statutory and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) requirements.


Key Responsibilities
Business partnering & stakeholder management in Haleon* Build strategic relationship with a network of senior Haleon local/regional/functional/site stakeholders, to understand business requirements, identify opportunities to create value and to position WPS’s value proposition.
* Influence key stakeholders and business partners to support strategy development endorse recommend strategies, support execution and agree how benefit delivery will be budgeted


Strategy execution  

* Align with broader WPS team and work in collaboration with them to provide local business requirements and market information
* Execute strategies in scope of responsibility aligned with the requirements of stakeholders and business partners

Drive operational efficiency  

* Challenge requirements and educate stakeholder to drive maximum contract and policy compliance, employee experience and strategy alignment
* Drive operational simplification across WPS areas and processes in scope

External supplier relationships  

* Build strategic relationships with key regional/local suppliers at a senior level and lead processes to ensure value is driven from these relationships. Ensure local considerations are accounted global & regional supplier relationships.
* Ensure regional considerations are taken into account in global supplier negotiations and contracts
* Develop and Implement Operational excellence strategies and plans for key regional/local suppliers to drive improvements against KPIs.

Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert.  

When applying for this role, please use the cover letter, the online application or your CV to describe how you meet the competencies for this role, as outlined in the job requirements above. The information that you have provided in your cover letter and CV will be used to assess your application.
Qualifications & Skills:
Minimum Level of Education Required: Bachelor’s Degree
Area of Specialisation: Real-Estate/Facilities management, Business, Finance, Supply Chain, Marketing* 10+ years of Hands-on Operational experience Real-Estate/Facilities/Procurement management.
* Hands on knowledge in Vendor Management, Vendor sourcing, quotation analysis, contract negotiation, supplier review, supplier development and others.
* Demonstrated expertise in managing categories, particularly category strategy development and implementation, stakeholder management and supplier relationship management.
* In-depth understanding of external environment and supplier relationship models
* Strong knowledge of finance (cost benchmark, financial audit with key suppliers) and legal matters (contracting)
* Clear understanding of business value, business priorities, and potential implementation risks
* Significant experience working in a matrix (global/ regional) business environment.
* Strong networking skills and a proven ability to build productive and collaborative relationships with stakeholders and business partners.
* Ability to prioritize multiple tasks across multiple projects using project management skills.
* Strong analytical, written and verbal communications, and influencing skills.
* Ability to work in high pressure environment, often under tight deadlines.
* Experience with risk management


Why is this level of experience required?* The role holder is expected to be able to influence senior leaders effectively.
* The role holder is expected to be able to deliver significant transformation and change.
* The role holder is expected to be able to develop and deliver WPS strategies that are aligned with the business’s requirements.
* The role holder is expected to lead Local and some Regional WPS strategy
* The role holder is expected to manage significant projects.
* The role holder is expected to have significant external supplier and market knowledge.
* The role holder is expected to be able to benchmark externally to identify new opportunities and ensure competitive performance and is expected to be able to identify best practices externally and implement them in HALEON.

*Diversity, Equity and Inclusion*
At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.
We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/
